title: Application Manager to Boliden
description:
Boliden is a high-tech metal company with its own mines and smelters, committed to ensuring society’s supply of base and precious metals while striving to be world’s most climate-friendly and respected metal provider. Our work has been integral to the value chains that have shaped modern society for a century. The metals we mine and produce will play a crucial role in the future – it is how we produce them that matters. Join us in driving change for generations to come.  

Your opportunity:
As an Application Manager at Boliden, you will lead and coordinate the work to maintain the company's applications. You will work closely with other members of the IT service team, business departments that use the applications, and external vendors to resolve current issues and drive system improvements forward. You will ensure that the applications you are responsible for support the business needs, are user-friendly, cost-effective to maintain, have high IT security, and that operations and development align with Boliden IT strategy. Your role also involves participating in relevant projects related to your applications. The position is a temporary assignment for the year 2025, with a strong possibility of becoming a permanent role.
Who you will work with:
You will collaborate with many people within Boliden and beyond. This role requires the ability to cooperate and find solutions in both simple and difficult situations. Parts of the work can be done by a vendor, but it is your responsibility to manage the collaboration and ensure that the vendor meets set expectations. We help each other out. It's a great team!
What you will do:* Manage and develop IT solutions
* Ensure the application supports the business, is useful, brings value or reduces cost, is reliable, has high user satisfaction, and high IT security.
* Handle tasks independently with a tactical and operational nature in IT.
* Work proactively to anticipate risks and opportunities with the application.
* Participate in relevant projects related to your applications.
  

What you bring:* Education: Post-secondary education or extensive experience.
* Experience: Experience working with systems/IT coordination, integrations not necessarily at a senior level.
* Skills: Self-sufficient, service-minded, and able to work without detailed supervision.
* Languages: Proficiency in Swedish and English.
* License: Driver's license for a passenger car.
  

Preferred qualifications:* Education/Experience: Background in economics or computer science.
* Experience: Experience with cloud-based systems and on-premises systems, previous experience with similar tasks in larger companies, and good IT technical understanding.
* Additional: Familiarity with internal control audits/ISO standards is a plus. Experience from metal industry sales/procurement and knowledge of chemistry.
  

Personal qualities:* Initiative-taking, problem-solving, and responsibility.
* Flexible and varied tasks, working both in a team and individually.
* Strong communication and coordination skills.
* Eager to learn
  

Why work with us:
Boliden offers an innovative and collaborative environment where you will have the opportunity to shape the future of our operations. We value initiative, creativity and the courage to challenge the status quo. As part of a forward-thinking team, you will be at the forefront of advancing our industry through automation and digitalization, contributing to both green metals production and overall profitability. Join us in driving the next phase of technological advancement.  

Apply today to be part of something truly meaningful!
Do you want to know more about the position? Contact Head of Section, Application Management Team, Jenny Furtenbach, Jenny.furtenbach@boliden.com. Want to know more about the recruiting process? Please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Adam Martinez, adam.martinez@boliden.com.  

Union information is available from Ingela Scherling Saco +46 70 272 08 68, Andreas Mårtensson, Unionen, +46 70 541 83 93 or Peter Markström, Ledarna, +46 910 77 40 09.
Last day of application: 12th of January 2025.*If you are a representative of a recruiting firm, please refrain from contacting us about this* *posting**.* *We**appreciate**your**consideration**.*

title: Environmental Health Safety, Site Lead – Gävleborg, Sweden
description:
**Environmental Health Safety, Site Lead – Gävleborg, Sweden**

**Title:** Environmental Health Safety, Site Lead

**Department:** HSEQ Department

**Reports To:** Project Manager and EHS Manager

**About us:** *Established in 1999, CET Connect has been a leader in structured cabling services, providing unparalleled connectivity solutions for a diverse range of projects. In 2023, MTM Engineering acquired CET Connect, seamlessly integrating us into the MTM Family. As an MTM Company, we bring together the legacy of CET Connect with the strength and innovation of MTM Engineering. With strategically located offices in Ireland (Clonmel and Dublin), the UK, France, Sweden, and Germany, we are dedicated to offering seamless and reliable solutions to our clients. Our extensive experience spans a wide spectrum of infrastructure projects, from state-of-the-art Data Centres to Hospitals and everything in between*.

**The Role..**

CET Connect have a position available for an EHS Lead located in Gävle, Sweden. As an EHS Lead you will oversee project EHS Team assisting the project team and implement and maintain company management systems for the project duration. The successful EHS Lead will coordinate all EHS matters and report any issues directly to the Project Manager and EHS Manager.

**Your role as an EHS Advisor;**

* Manage and work closely with the CET Team on the project and direct all functions of their job role on site,
* Engage with CET Project Manager on work scope look ahead and develop Site Specific RAMS for works scope,
* Engage with main contractor Safety Team for site mobilization of team members to the project in line with local requirements *(Supported by CET HQ Safety Team),*
* Ensure CET EHS management systems is implemented and maintained for the project in line with project specific EHS Plans received from PSCS,
* Ensure project training matrix is up to date and training in place for all CET team members *(Supported by CET HQ Team)*
* Coordination in the development safe plan of action, permit to work with the CET team on site and main contractor,
* Ensure project PPE is resourced & available and communicated to Project Manager,
* Provide advice and training in all EHS matters to management, safety representatives and team members,
* Provide leadership and coordination of the day-to-day EHS requirements of the projects and promote a positive safety culture,
* Attend and provide input at Site meetings, report on work scope EHS risks, trends and recommend constructive actions towards continuous improvements,
* Review and carry out digital audits, inspections & incident investigation reports, establish corrective and preventive actions to prevent reoccurrence and continuous improvements with site team engagement,
* Develop and complete site-specific Toolbox Talks on site aligned with site audits and EHS findings to help promote a positive safety culture and high level of compliance,
* Review documentation within the project cloud safety folder, (GA2, GA3, SPA’s, RAMS Sign off’s, Safety Statement Sign Off’s, Inductions, PPE Records, Site Audits, TBT’s etc.) managed and submitted weekly,

**Your Qualifications and Key Criteria:**

* Relevant third level Certificate qualification in Environmental, Health & Safety.
* Thorough knowledge of current environmental, health and safety legislation
* Flexibility in working patterns where necessary,
* Ability to efficiently manage all environmental, health and safety issues on site with current EHS team on site,
* Strong communication & computer skills,
* Ability to work on own initiative and possess strong interpersonal and communications skills alongside project manager,
* Previous site experience 3 years minimum,
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Package,
* Remuneration will be in line with qualifications and experience,
* Accommodation and Car Hire supplied,
* Rotation package on offer fly in fly out model.

**Interested in working with CET Connect?**

Please apply directly with your CV by email to: Lisa Cummins, HR Administrator, CET Connect Ltd at lcummins@cet.ie

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: 36 931,06kr - 65 000,00kr per year

Ability to commute/relocate:

* Gävleborgs Län: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Experience:

* EHS: 1 year (Required)

Work authorization:

* Sweden (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Finance Automation Lead
description:
This role is part of the European HQ Divisional Finance team and can be based at any of our European Country Head Offices. The role will operate on a hybrid basis with an ad hoc requirement to travel to office locations around the Europe region.


As a Finance Automation Lead, you will play a pivotal role in driving digital transformation within our finance department. You will lead the identification, design, and implementation of automation solutions, leveraging advanced analytics and data visualisation tools like Power BI, Anaplan, and Qlik Sense, to streamline processes, reduce manual effort, and enhance accuracy and efficiency.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Regional Reporting and Consolidation:**


Data Integration and Modeling:

* Design and implement data integration pipelines to consolidate financial data from various regional sources.
* Develop robust data models to support accurate and timely consolidation of regional financial results.


Advanced Analytics and Forecasting:

* Utilize advanced analytics techniques to support the identification of trends and anomalies in regional performance.
* Leverage selected forecasting solution to build sophisticated financial models and forecasts for regional operations.
* Develop early warning systems and alerts to proactively identify potential risks and opportunities.


Data Visualization and Reporting:

* Create interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI and Qlik Sense (or equivalent system) to provide timely insights into regional performance.
* Customize visualizations to meet the specific needs of regional finance teams and executive leadership.
* Automate report generation and distribution to streamline the reporting process.


Automation and Process Optimization:

* Identify opportunities to automate repetitive tasks, such as data collection, validation, and consolidation.
* Integrate automation solutions with Power BI, Anaplan, and Qlik Sense to create end-to-end automated processes.
* Continuously monitor and optimize automation processes to ensure efficiency and accuracy.

**Country Reporting and Forecasting:**


Data Integration and Modeling:

* Design and implement data integration pipelines to consolidate financial data from various country sources.
* Develop robust data models to support accurate and timely country-level financial reporting and forecasting.


Advanced Analytics and Forecasting:

* Utilize advanced analytics techniques to support the identification of trends and anomalies in regional performance.
* Develop early warning systems and alerts to proactively identify potential risks and opportunities.


Roll out Anaplan FP&A to the European Counties:

* Review the existing Anaplan FP&A model and develop or build the complex modules so that it is appropriate for our needs
* Roll out the finalised Anaplan model to the rest of Europe over time implementing at least 6 countries in 2025
* Continuously monitor and optimize processes to ensure efficiency and accuracy.
* Develop early warning systems and alerts to proactively identify potential risks and opportunities.
* Engage, train and assist new users on both Anaplan and its models
* Provide support to the team during the preparation of the company’s budgeting / Forecasting cycles including Budget presentations
* Administration of the Anaplan model and system


Data Visualization and Reporting:

* Create interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI and Qlik Sense (or equivalent system) to provide timely insights into country-level performance.
* Customize visualizations to meet the specific needs of country finance teams and regional leadership.
* Automate report generation and distribution to streamline the reporting process.


Automation and Process Optimization:

* Identify opportunities to automate repetitive tasks, such as data collection, validation, and reporting.
* Integrate automation solutions with Power BI, Anaplan, or Qlik Sense (or equivalent system) to create end-to-end automated processes.
* Continuously monitor and optimize automation processes to ensure efficiency and accuracy.

  

Company Description *This role is part of the European HQ Divisional Finance team and can be based at any of our European Country Head Offices*  

  

**Rentokil Initial plc**  

  

Rentokil Initial (RI) delivers services that ‘Protect People, Enhance Lives’. We protect people from the risks of pest-borne disease, the risks of poor hygiene or from injury in the workplace. We aim to enhance lives with services that protect the health and wellbeing of people and the reputation of our customers’ brands. Throughout the world, demand for higher standards of public health, stricter food safety legislation and compliance with workplace safety regulations are driving demand for our service expertise.  

  

Rentokil Initial Norway is a global support services company, operating in all of the major economies of Europe, North America, Asia Pacific and Africa:

* Rentokil Initial is a FTSE 60 company and operates in over 90 countries with revenues of over £5bn.
* We are a ‘people business’ with over 60,000 colleagues.
* We offer a wide range of services to businesses, the public sector and residential customers.
* Our core market categories are Pest Control and Hygiene/Washroom services.
* Market leading positions in major markets - UK, US, Australia, France and emerging Asian and Latin American markets.
* Contract based businesses with >85% retention rates.


Rentokil Initial has identified three core values that underpin our business - Service, Relationships and Teamwork.  

By living our values, we are better placed to offer consistently outstanding customer service.

  

Qualifications **Must have:**

* Strong understanding of finance and accounting principles.
* Proficiency in Power BI or Qlik Sense (or equivalent systems).
* Certification in Anaplan with 4 years of experience in Finance FP&A models. Ideally have also participated in Anaplan implementation
* Experience in data modeling, data integration, and data visualization.
* Knowledge of advanced analytics techniques, such as predictive modeling and time series analysis.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to lead and motivate teams.
* Detail-oriented and results-driven.

**Nice to have:**

* Certification in either Power BI, or Qlik Sense (or equivalent systems).
* Experience with RPA tools (e.g., UiPath, Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism).
* Knowledge of cloud-based data platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP).


If you are passionate about driving innovation and efficiency in finance, leveraging the power of data and automation, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

  

Additional Information  

Rentokil Initial is home to everyone; feel free to come as you are

title: Affärskonsulter IFS
description:
**Affärskonsulter**
===================

Är du antingen:



– Expert inom Service  

– Slipad på Tillverkning  

– Eller har fokus Ekonomi



Har du erfarenhet av ERP-system, gärna IFS Applications eller IFS Cloud?



Önskar du jobba med seniora medarbetare och vara med och bygga ett bolag där man stöttar framgångsrika företag?



Läs vidare, eller, ta kontakt med oss!


Vi upplever stor efterfrågan från våra kunder – vilket vi, möjligen aningen förmätet, tolkar som att vi uppskattas. Kunderna uppskattar vår expertkunskap, vårt oberoende, vår prestigelöshet – i kombination med vårt tydliga fokus på IFS. De gillar också att vi gärna samarbetar med ”alla”.



Under året har vi fått möjlighet att bistå både strategiskt och operativt i stora projekt till IFS Cloud, likväl som i utrullningar och förvaltning. När vi nu blickar fram emot 2025 söker vi främst dig som skulle kunna ta en uppskattad roll hos oss, eller snarare våra kunder, som:


* Affärskonsult med Servicefokus
* Affärskonsult med fokus på tillverkning
* Affärskonsult med fokus ekonomi
* Projektledare

  



När vi rekryterar tittar vi dock fortsatt främst på dig som person. Har du en kompetens som ligger ”mitt i” något av ovan områden är det kanon. Men, om du har din kärnkompetens någon annanstans kan du ändå vara rätt – som sagt, viktigast är din stil och attityd. Är du rätt för oss, ja då är du med väldigt stor sannolikhet även helrätt för våra kunder.



Välkommen med din ansökan eller bara ett informellt samtal!



Per Aronsson
VD Align Consulting AB
+46 70 711 70 17

title: Principal Machine Learning Engineer [F/M/X]
description:
Job description
  
  

As a Principal Machine Learning Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and reviewing advanced machine learning models and architectures. You will play a key role in leading complex AI/ML project initiatives, providing technical guidance and architectural oversight to cross-functional engineering teams. You will also be involved in in-depth research and experimentation to evaluate emerging AI technologies and develop proof-of-concept solutions.
  
  

**Daily Tasks:**  

Design, develop, and review advanced machine learning models and architectures, including deep learning, optimization, and generative AI systems.
  
Lead complex AI/ML project initiatives, providing technical guidance and architectural oversight to cross-functional engineering teams.
  
Conduct in-depth research and experimentation to evaluate emerging AI technologies, assess their potential applications, and develop proof-of-concept solutions.
  
Review and optimize existing AI systems for performance, scalability, and efficiency, implementing advanced techniques like model compression and transfer learning.
  
Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical AI strategies and implementation roadmaps.
  
  

**Profile Requirement:**  

**Minimum Technical Skills:**  

Expert-level proficiency in Python, with a deep understanding of machine learning libraries.
  
Advanced knowledge of machine learning algorithms, neural network architectures, and AI model development.
  
Extensive experience with cloud platforms (must have GCP, nice to have Azure) and AI/ML cloud services.
  
Strong background in statistical modeling, data preprocessing, and feature engineering.
  
Proficiency in big data technologies and distributed computing frameworks.
  
Demonstrated ability to design and implement scalable machine learning infrastructure.
  
  

**Leadership and Experience Level:**  

Minimum of 8-10 years of professional experience in AI/ML engineering.
  
Proven track record of leading complex AI initiatives from conception to production.
  
Senior technical leadership experience, capable of mentoring junior engineers and driving technical strategy.
  
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  
Demonstrated innovation in AI research or practical applications.
  
  

Why Join Us?
  
We offer a stimulating work environment where innovation is encouraged, and you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects. If you are passionate about artificial intelligence and want to be part of a dynamic team, we would love to receive your application!
  
  

Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.
  
  

Who are we?
  
Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7500 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.
  
  

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:
  
  

**Brief Call:** Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!
  
  

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
  
  

**Case study:** Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.
  
  

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
  
We look forward to meeting you!
company_description: Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. It gathers more than 7,500 people across 5 continents and more than 60 countries.

title: Senior HR Partner
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
We are looking for a Senior HR Partner!
Tietoevry Banking is the leading financial services software and solution partner in the Nordics. We offer modular, pre-integrated banking as a service solutions and market-leading software for core, payments, credit, cards, financial fraud, and wealth. With our scale, expertise, and specialization, we empower financial institutions to enhance agility, efficiency, and accelerate digital transformation.
The tech-market keeps expanding, and so does Tietoevry Banking. We are now looking for an HR-professional to join us in Stockholm. You will work both locally and globally to drive and support business need and growth. The primary focus will be on the local market in Sweden driving transformational projects and union stakeholder management, but also take active part in global HR deliverables and projects. We are in an exciting time where we have an opportunity to re-think how we operate and work within the HR-function, while leveraging what is already great. We are looking for HR professional with the capability to steer and drive on their own as well as contributing to process and projects. You will be part of a global HR team, reporting to Lead HR Business partner.
With us you will* Manage, drive and support transformation projects
* Support global business unit’s managers with strategic and operational support
* Participate in HR projects
* Follow up data and reports and make analysis in relation to turnover, hires, leavers, and attrition
* Experience with Swedish labour law, collective agreements and cooperation/consultation with Unions
* Co-create workshop and presentation material
* Provide input and knowledge to our HR function to constantly improve the ways of working


Who you are?* Degree in Human Resources Management or equivalent
* Experienced HR professional with knowledge in Swedish labour law and union stakeholder management
* Previously worked in an international environment
* Enjoying change management and projects
* Proactive with a problem-solving mindset
* Ability to plan and execute tasks and projects
* Responsible and structured
* Works independently as well as in a team
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and oral


We offer* An exciting role covering local and global market
* Team support and the great colleagues
* Constant possibilities to learn
* Culture that is built on transparency and active sharing


The position might require travelling from time to time.
About the company
Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. We work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
We look forward to hearing from you
If you have any questions, reach out to Per Christian Blom, internal Search consultant. Contact info, phone 00 46 97720235, perchristian.blom@tietoevry.com
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Video- och bildproducent till kulturförvaltningen
description:
Stockholm – vår huvudstad med miljoner drömmar, förväntningar och ambitioner. Vi jobbar för alla som lever här idag och i framtiden. Nu söker vi dig som vill tänka stort, nytt och annorlunda med oss – för stockholmarna.


Kultur är en viktig del av Stockholms nervsystem och berör miljontals människor varje år. På Kulturförvaltningen arbetar vi tillsammans för att stärka kulturlivet i Stockholm. Vi skapar möjligheter för stadens invånare och besökare att ta del av och själva skapa kultur. Hos oss råder ett öppet arbetsklimat där medarbetarna i allra högsta grad är delaktiga i utvecklingen. Var med och bidra till att Stockholm växer med kultur!


Kommunikationsstaben söker nu en video- och bildproducent/visuell kommunikatör för en tidsbegränsad anställning med tillträde omgående. Vikariatet sträcker sig till och med den 5 september 2025.

### **Välkommen till oss**


Kommunikationsstaben ansvarar för den strategiska kommunikationen för kulturförvaltningens verksamheter. Staben består av cirka tio kommunikatörer som rapporterar direkt till kommunikationschefen. Vi har de kompetenser som krävs för en komplett inhouse-byrå: förutom videoproducenten finns strateger, grafiska formgivare, produktionsledare samt en presschef. Vi tar fram kampanjer, producerar evenemang och digitala möten, driver varumärkesarbete och sköter kris- och mediehantering. Vi arbetar även med innehåll för alla typer av digitala kanaler, pr, grafisk formgivning samt foto- och filmproduktion. Vi håller till i en modern aktivitetsbaserad kontorsmiljö i Rinkeby, och åker såklart runt i verksamheterna.

### **Vi erbjuder**


Hos oss får du goda förutsättningar till utveckling med en trygg arbetsgivare som har kompassen inställd på framtiden. Exempelvis pågår just nu ett omfattande projekt för digital kompetensutveckling för alla kulturförvaltningens medarbetare. Tjänsten har flextid. Övriga förmåner i Stockholm stad: https://jobba.stockholm/formaner/

### **Din roll**


I rollen som video- och bildproducent kommer du vara med och utveckla kulturförvaltningens övergripande kommunikation med hjälp av rörligt innehåll och bild. Du kommer att utgå från beslutade strategier och mål och arbeta teambaserat med idéarbete, produktion och uppföljning av digitala kampanjer. Du samarbetar med alla på kommunikationsstaben och coachar medarbetare i alla våra verksamheter. Du samverkar även med andra förvaltningar i staden och externa samarbetspartners.


Du är en mästare på att samordna kommunikationsinsatser och att snabbt skapa engagemang i våra kanaler. Vi vill att du ska vara en klippa på att filma, klippa, redigera och efterbearbeta. Du har god struktur och god hand med dem som ska filmas och fotograferas.

### **Din kompetens och erfarenhet**


För denna roll krävs att du har:

* Högskoleutbildning inom kommunikation och medier, alternativt annan utbildning i kombination med arbetslivserfarenhet som visuell kommunikatör.
* Minst tre års arbetslivserfarenhet av produktion och publicering av rörlig kommunikation/videoproduktion för sociala medier och andra plattformar.
* Gedigen och uppdaterad kunskap inom content marketing.
* Erfarenhet av arbete mot olika målgrupper
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Mycket goda kunskaper i:
	+ Adobe Creative Cloud
	+ Webbpublicering- och uppföljningsverktyg


Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:

* Projektledning
* Manusarbete för rörliga produktioner


Du måste vara självgående, prestigelös och duktig på att skapa goda relationer. Du ska trivas med att arbeta i många olika team samtidigt. Du är en person som tycker om att ta initiativ, tänka nytt och vara med och driva arbetet framåt.

### **Övrigt**


Vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en förvaltning fri från diskriminering. Det är viktigt för oss att all kompetens tas tillvara och vi välkomnar alla sökande.


Vi rekryterar utan det personliga brevet i denna rekrytering för att stärka fokus på de kompetenser och erfarenheter som efterfrågas för denna roll. Vid bedömningen av din ansökan kommer vi endast att utgå ifrån ditt CV och ett antal frågor du får besvara i samband med att du söker tjänsten. Vi önskar att du svarar konkret och kortfattat på frågorna, och att det finns en tydlig koppling mellan dina svar och ditt CV.


I denna rekrytering ingår det tester som en del i bedömningen i samband med urval.


Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.  



Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/6248 | Kontakt: Rebecka Ioannidis Lindberg 08-50831813, | Facklig företrädare: Ernesto Garzón, Vision 08-50831742, Maria Sundström, DIK 08-50831588, Dick Morén, Saco 08-50840622, | Publicerat: 2024-12-18 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-01-01

title: Kommunikatör
description:
Bli en del av Borås Stad!


Välkommen att arbeta i Bildningsstaden Borås, hos oss är varje dag meningsfull. Förutom ett meningsfullt arbete och professionella kollegor erbjuder Borås Stad en rad förmåner och attraktiva arbetsvillkor för att du ska trivas och må bra. Professionell, engagerad och lärande är nyckelord för Borås Stads verksamheter, såväl i mötet med boråsarna som i relation med kollegor.

#### **Din nästa arbetsplats**


Välkommen till Vuxenutbildningen i Borås Stad. Vi gör skillnad varje dag.


Vuxenutbildningen i Borås utbildar för arbete eller vidare studier och vi lägger stor vikt vid meningsfull undervisning, rätt stöd och yrkespraktik. Verksamheten omfattar SFI, Lärvux, Yrkeshögskola, grundläggande och gymnasiala kurser samt yrkesvux. Med över 180 medarbetare och 5000 elever är vi en växande del av Gymnasie- och vuxenutbildningsförvaltningen. Du kommer att spela en viktig roll i att synliggöra och stödja vårt betydelsefulla arbete inom utbildning för vuxna.

#### **Din anställning**


Anställningsform: Tillsvidare på heltid. 100%. Tillträde: Tillträde: 2025-04-01 eller enligt överenskommelse.. Löneform: Enligt avtal.

#### **Dina arbetsuppgifter**


Som kommunikatör hos oss arbetar du både strategiskt och operativt med att stärka och utveckla Vuxenutbildningens interna och externa kommunikation. Du stöttar ledningsgruppen med kommunikationsplanering, kriskommunikation och vid mediekontakter. Du coachar och stöttar chefer i kommunikativt ansvar. Du ansvarar för att medarbetare och invånare möts av tydlig, målgruppsanpassad och tillgänglig kommunikation. En stor del av arbetet handlar också om att synliggöra och marknadsföra Vuxenutbildningen och våra utbildningar.


Du beställer och kvalitetssäkrar uppdrag från reklambyrå och säkerställer att våra verksamheter arbetar med rätt grafisk profil. Du skriver pressmeddelanden, artiklar, nyheter med mera. Du har det övergripande ansvaret för Vuxenutbildningens digitala kanaler, såsom webbplatser och sociala medier.


Du kommer att ha ett nära samarbete med förvaltningens centrala kommunikatör samt med Borås Stads centrala kommunikationsavdelning. Du ingår också i ett nätverk med Borås Stads alla kommunikatörer.

#### **Du som söker**


Vi söker dig som har relevant högskoleutbildning, till exempel Kommunikatörsprogrammet, kandidatexamen inom medie- och kommunikationsvetenskap eller motsvarande.


Du är van att arbeta med många olika uppdrag parallellt och kan växla mellan strategiskt tänkande och praktisk handling. Du har ett strategiskt tankesätt som du omsätter i kommunikationsinsatser. Arbetsuppgifterna kräver att du självständigt kan prioritera, strukturera och driva ditt arbete från start till mål. Du har förmågan att snabbt kunna ställa om till nya förutsättningar när situationen så kräver. Du är skicklig på skriftlig kommunikation med god form- och språkkänsla och har förmågan att strukturera information och hitta kärnan i komplexa sammanhang.


Du behärskar Adobe Creative Cloud samt webbpubliceringsverktyg, gärna Sitevision.


Vi vill också att du bifogar några arbetsprover som visar på din kommunikativa förmåga.

#### **Vill du veta mer?**

* RektorPia Solberg, 0768-88 71 44, pia.wahlstrom.solberg@boras.se


Intervjuer kommer att ske 17 januari.


Fackliga företrädare når du via Borås Stads växel, tfn 033-35 70 00.


Läs mer om Borås Stads personalförmåner.


Gymnasie- och vuxenutbildningsnämndens övertygelse är att alla elever vill och kan lära.


Läs mer i förvaltningens utvecklingsplan Bildningsstaden Borås.


Vi värdesätter de kvaliteter som en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.

#### **Ansökan**


Din ansökan med bifogade dokument skickar du via vår ansökningsfunktion som du når via "Sök jobbet" nedan.

#### **Sista ansökningsdag**


Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-01-12

title: Finance Automation Lead
description:
**Company Description** *This role is part of the European HQ Divisional Finance team and can be based at any of our European Country Head Offices*  

  

**Rentokil Initial plc**  

  

Rentokil Initial (RI) delivers services that ‘Protect People, Enhance Lives’. We protect people from the risks of pest-borne disease, the risks of poor hygiene or from injury in the workplace. We aim to enhance lives with services that protect the health and wellbeing of people and the reputation of our customers’ brands. Throughout the world, demand for higher standards of public health, stricter food safety legislation and compliance with workplace safety regulations are driving demand for our service expertise.  

  

Rentokil Initial Norway is a global support services company, operating in all of the major economies of Europe, North America, Asia Pacific and Africa:

* Rentokil Initial is a FTSE 60 company and operates in over 90 countries with revenues of over £5bn.
* We are a ‘people business’ with over 60,000 colleagues.
* We offer a wide range of services to businesses, the public sector and residential customers.
* Our core market categories are Pest Control and Hygiene/Washroom services.
* Market leading positions in major markets - UK, US, Australia, France and emerging Asian and Latin American markets.
* Contract based businesses with >85% retention rates.


Rentokil Initial has identified three core values that underpin our business - Service, Relationships and Teamwork.  

By living our values, we are better placed to offer consistently outstanding customer service.

 **Job Description**  

This role is part of the European HQ Divisional Finance team and can be based at any of our European Country Head Offices. The role will operate on a hybrid basis with an ad hoc requirement to travel to office locations around the Europe region.


As a Finance Automation Lead, you will play a pivotal role in driving digital transformation within our finance department. You will lead the identification, design, and implementation of automation solutions, leveraging advanced analytics and data visualisation tools like Power BI, Anaplan, and Qlik Sense, to streamline processes, reduce manual effort, and enhance accuracy and efficiency.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Regional Reporting and Consolidation:**


Data Integration and Modeling:

* Design and implement data integration pipelines to consolidate financial data from various regional sources.
* Develop robust data models to support accurate and timely consolidation of regional financial results.


Advanced Analytics and Forecasting:

* Utilize advanced analytics techniques to support the identification of trends and anomalies in regional performance.
* Leverage selected forecasting solution to build sophisticated financial models and forecasts for regional operations.
* Develop early warning systems and alerts to proactively identify potential risks and opportunities.


Data Visualization and Reporting:

* Create interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI and Qlik Sense (or equivalent system) to provide timely insights into regional performance.
* Customize visualizations to meet the specific needs of regional finance teams and executive leadership.
* Automate report generation and distribution to streamline the reporting process.


Automation and Process Optimization:

* Identify opportunities to automate repetitive tasks, such as data collection, validation, and consolidation.
* Integrate automation solutions with Power BI, Anaplan, and Qlik Sense to create end-to-end automated processes.
* Continuously monitor and optimize automation processes to ensure efficiency and accuracy.

**Country Reporting and Forecasting:**


Data Integration and Modeling:

* Design and implement data integration pipelines to consolidate financial data from various country sources.
* Develop robust data models to support accurate and timely country-level financial reporting and forecasting.


Advanced Analytics and Forecasting:

* Utilize advanced analytics techniques to support the identification of trends and anomalies in regional performance.
* Develop early warning systems and alerts to proactively identify potential risks and opportunities.


Roll out Anaplan FP&A to the European Counties:

* Review the existing Anaplan FP&A model and develop or build the complex modules so that it is appropriate for our needs
* Roll out the finalised Anaplan model to the rest of Europe over time implementing at least 6 countries in 2025
* Continuously monitor and optimize processes to ensure efficiency and accuracy.
* Develop early warning systems and alerts to proactively identify potential risks and opportunities.
* Engage, train and assist new users on both Anaplan and its models
* Provide support to the team during the preparation of the company’s budgeting / Forecasting cycles including Budget presentations
* Administration of the Anaplan model and system


Data Visualization and Reporting:

* Create interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI and Qlik Sense (or equivalent system) to provide timely insights into country-level performance.
* Customize visualizations to meet the specific needs of country finance teams and regional leadership.
* Automate report generation and distribution to streamline the reporting process.


Automation and Process Optimization:

* Identify opportunities to automate repetitive tasks, such as data collection, validation, and reporting.
* Integrate automation solutions with Power BI, Anaplan, or Qlik Sense (or equivalent system) to create end-to-end automated processes.
* Continuously monitor and optimize automation processes to ensure efficiency and accuracy.

 **Qualifications** **Must have:**

* Strong understanding of finance and accounting principles.
* Proficiency in Power BI or Qlik Sense (or equivalent systems).
* Certification in Anaplan with 4 years of experience in Finance FP&A models. Ideally have also participated in Anaplan implementation
* Experience in data modeling, data integration, and data visualization.
* Knowledge of advanced analytics techniques, such as predictive modeling and time series analysis.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to lead and motivate teams.
* Detail-oriented and results-driven.

**Nice to have:**

* Certification in either Power BI, or Qlik Sense (or equivalent systems).
* Experience with RPA tools (e.g., UiPath, Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism).
* Knowledge of cloud-based data platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP).


If you are passionate about driving innovation and efficiency in finance, leveraging the power of data and automation, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

 **Additional Information**  

Rentokil Initial is home to everyone; feel free to come as you are

title: PLM Specialist
description:
Vi söker en Product Lifecycle Management Specialist
  
  

Välkommen till CTC! Vi är ett svenskt bolag i internationell toppklass. I Ljungby, mitt i de småländska skogarna, hittar du vårt huvudkontor och vår fabrik. De första värmeprodukterna utvecklade vi redan 1923 och det är med närmare hundra års samlad erfarenhet som vi nu tar steget vidare till nästa generations värmepumpar och innovativa lösningar. Med kunskap och handling skapar vi förutsättningar för en hållbar och bättre värld.
  
  

Vi söker en driven PLM-Specialist som med stort intresse och nyfikenhet vill vara med och utveckla våra system för produktutveckling och produktvård. Vårt PLM-system är 3Dexperience Cloud (från Dassault) med integration till vårt system för 3D-cad som är Solidworks.
  
  

OM JOBBET
  
  

Som PLM Specialist på CTC har du en central roll i verksamhetsutvecklingen. I din vardag kommer du att arbeta nära våra konstruktions-, produktutvecklings-, produktionsteknik- inköps- och projektledarteam. Du tillhör RD&E-avdelningen, som är en högteknologisk och avancerad produktutvecklingsavdelning. Avdelningen med cirka 40 anställda inom bland annat Mjukvara & Styrsystem, Mekanik, El/Elektronik, Kylteknik, Test & Verifiering samt Systemutveckling.
  
  

Du ingår i en systemägargrupp som projektleder, utvecklar och underhåller IT-system relaterade till RD&E- och marknadsavdelningen. I teamets arbete ingår att säkerställa effektiv användning, funktionalitet, implementation och säkerhet för systemen.
  
  

ARBETSUPPGIFTER
  
  

Optimering av arbetsflöden och systemstöd vid cad.
  
Konfigurering och uppsättning av regelverk för SolidWorks mot PDM/PLM.
  
Konfigurering av produktdata och attribut
  
Konfigurering av arbets- och granskningsflöden utifrån företagets processer
  
Uppsättning och underhåll av användarbehörigheter
  
Systemunderhåll
  
Specificering av integration med andra system
  
Användaranpassning
  
Systemarkitektur
  
**Ständiga förbättringar:** Identifiera möjligheter till processförbättringar och systemförbättringar för att öka effektiviteten och ändamålsenligheten.
  
**Efterlevnad:** Se till att PLM-processer följer branschstandarder, regler för CE-märkning och företagspolicyer.
  
**Främja samarbete:** Arbeta nära med tvärfunktionella team, inklusive teknik, tillverkning, kvalitetssäkring och leveranskedja, för att säkerställa sömlös integration av PLM-processer.
  
Delta kring utvecklingsplan (Roadmap) för berörda system/program
  
Projektledning inom PLM och verksamhetsprocesser
  
Delta i gruppens arbete kring förvaltning och vidareutveckling av systemen
  
  

OM DIG
  
  

Vi sätter stort värde på dina personliga egenskaper. Som person är du trygg och stabil, har en positiv grundsyn och trivs att jobba i team såväl som självständigt. Du har lätt för att lära, är kreativ och gillar att anta nya utmaningar. Rollen som systemägare för PLM innebär en del kontakter både internt och externt. Därför tror vi att det underlättar om du är kommunikativ, samarbetsinriktad och tycker om att bygga relationer. Du är utpräglat analytisk, strukturerad och organiserad. Du är initiativrik och drivande i utvecklingen av vår verksamhet samt van att ha flera projekt i gång samtidigt. Du triggas av att hjälpa andra och lösa problem för användarna. Ett agilt förhållningssätt och serviceinriktad mentalitet är en självklarhet för dig. Holistiskt perspektiv och helhetsflöde är ledord i arbetet.
  
  

KVALIFIKATIONER
  
  

Tekniskt intresse inom PLM och cad/PDM (SolidWorks/3Dexperience eller annan programvara).
  
Gärna erfarenhet av konstruktionsarbete med SolidWorks eller annan programvara.
  
3-5 års relevant utbildning för området(produktutveckling, maskiningenjör, designingenjör, utvecklingsingenjör, cad/konstruktion, simulering, systemutveckling).
  
Erfarenhet av projektledning och/eller ändringshantering för tillverkande industri.
  
Erfarenhet inom utbildning och/eller support.
  
Vana av olika IT-system såsom ERP, MES, MOM eller andra system för tillverkande industri.
  
Erfarenhet av programmering eller systemutveckling är ett plus, men inget krav.
  
  

OM OSS
  
  

Vi erbjuder möjlighet att få vara med och utveckla produkter som bidrar till en hållbar framtid.
  
CTCs arbetsmiljö kännetecknas av samarbete, engagemang och ödmjukhet. På RD&E (utvecklingsavdelningen) råder samma värderingstyrda kultur som i hela CTC, där delaktighet och att man hjälps åt oavsett funktion är viktiga grundstenar.
  
För rätt person kan vi erbjuda en utmanande tjänst i ett spännande företag med korta beslutsvägar, hög puls och allt under ett tak. Det finns både en bred och djup kompetens som gör att vi tillsammans kan ta oss an utmaningar i form av ny teknik som gör oss framgångsrika i utveckling av nya produkter.

title: Konsult inom Analytics
description:
Vi växer och söker nu en driven och tekniskt kunnig **Konsult inom Analytics** med fokus på bemästrande av ett helt eko-system i Analytics-verktyg.


Du har antagligen en bakgrund inom **Microsoft Fabric, Azure , Power BI, SQL, Qlik Sense/Qlik Cloud mfl**.


I rollen kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att hjälpa våra kunder att bygga moderna analyslösningar och fatta bättre beslut genom datadrivna insikter.


Som Analytics-konsult hos oss blir du en viktig del av ett engagerat team som brinner för att skapa affärsnytta genom avancerade dataanalyser och innovativa verktyg. Du kommer att arbeta i spännande projekt som innefattar Microsofts plattformar, Fabric, Power BI, Microsoft Power-tools mfl, Qlik och andra ledande teknologier.

**Arbetsuppgifter:**

* Utveckla och implementera lösningar inom bland annat **Microsoft Fabric** för dataintegration och analys.
* Designa och bygga dashboards, rapporter och datamodeller i **Power BI**.
* Utveckla och optimera lösningar i **Qlik Sense** och **Qlik Cloud**.
* Utföra databearbetning, datalagring och optimering med **SQL**
* Tillämpa AI-verktyg för att effektivisera arbete och inspirera kunder
* Skapa effektiva och automatiserade datalösningar för våra kunder.
* Samverka med kunder för att kartlägga behov, identifiera möjligheter och leverera skalbara datalösningar.
* Analysera datamängder för att identifiera insikter och affärsförbättrande åtgärder.

**Krav som tar dig närmare jobbet:*** Erfarenhet av att arbeta med **Power BI** för att skapa interaktiva dashboards och rapporter
* Kunskap om **Qlik Sense** och **Qlik Cloud** för att utveckla avancerade analyslösningar.
* Hög kunskap i **SQL** för databearbetning och datamodellering.
* Erfarenhet eller intresse av att arbeta med **Microsoft Fabric** och andra molnbaserade analysverktyg.
* Erfarenhet av Azure-tjänster kopplade till data och analys, exempelvis Azure Data Factory eller Synapse Analytics.
* Förståelse för dataintegration, ETL-processer och dataplattformar.
* God kommunikativ förmåga och vana att presentera tekniska lösningar för olika intressenter.

**Meriterande:**

* Erfarenhet i att ha jobba i agila projekt, Scrum eller liknande
* Kunskap om programmeringsspråk som **Python** eller **DAX**.
* Förståelse och kunskap i att tillämpa AI, Chatgpt, Copilot, Gemini mfl. i Analytics-lösningar.

**Mindcamp erbjuder**

  

En arbetsplats med stor frihet under ansvar. Vi är ledande inom Business Intelligence och datadrivna lösningar. Vi jobbar med hela eko-systemet av tekniker inom Analytics. Om vi får säga det själva så är vi grymma konsulter! Vi har en härlig gemenskap med hög kunskap och försöker att ha så roligt vi kan på jobbet. Vi erbjuder en verksamhet med tillväxt och högt tempo, där du som person kan växa i flera dimensioner, inte minst inom teknik och ledarskap. Vi är helt enkelt ett glatt gäng med briljanta tankar som är väldigt måna om att vår arbetsplats skall erbjuda en trivsam tillvaro. Hos oss är alla ansvariga för att bidra till utvecklingen av bolaget. Vi har en fast månadslön med en del rörligt som extra bonus. Vi erbjuder 30 semesterdagar/år, friskvårdsbidrag och en hel del roliga aktiviteter, -stora som små!

title: Security Engineer - SEB Embedded
description:
**We are looking for a Security Engineer to join our mission to pioneer the future of financial services!**

**Our team is committed to creating and reinforcing security within our SEB Embedded products and Banking as a Service platform. As a Security Engineer you will play a pivotal role in our cutting-edge team - working closely with the rest of the engineering community within SEB Embedded.**

**About us**  

We are a team with the mission to deliver expertise and tools to enable the rest of the organization to operate in a secure way. Currently the team consists of four security engineers and a security engineering manager, but we are growing to support our scaling organization. This phase of our growth journey will give great opportunities to develop and learn new areas within the field of security.


As a team we are focused on helping the business thrive by applying the exact right amount of security and creating easy to understand and use solutions. The team is made up of experienced security engineers who enjoy working together to solve real life problems.

**What you will do**  

Your main responsibilities will be to:

* Design, implement and maintain cloud security solutions
* Develop, improve and maintain technical security measures
* Develop and improve the roadmap and processes for secure architecture
* Develop and improve processes and guidelines for the secure software development lifecycle
* Perform security assessments through design and code review
* Provide guidance to stakeholders on IT security related matters
* Provide training on security awareness and security best practices to internal stakeholders


Your responsibilities will evolve over time depending on your areas of interest and desired growth path!

**Who you are**  

Communication and relationship building are key areas for success in this role, as well as the acumen to finding strategic compromises that enhance the overall business goals**.**


We expect you to have some of the following experiences:

* A few years of relevant security engineering experience.
* Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (we use GCP) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) as well as automation tools (e.g., Terraform).
* Hands-on experience securing cloud infrastructure using security tools and technologies (e.g., SIEM, SOAR, WAF).
* Understanding of software development practices (Python, Java, Golang or similar) in order to conduct code reviews
* Familiarity with security standards and regulations such as ISO 27001, CIS 18, PCI DSS, GDPR, DORA.
* Experience in Vulnerability Management, understanding different attack vectors, exploitation techniques, triage, assessment and the ability to follow up on vulnerabilities.
* Previous professional experience in a regulated industry

  

**What we offer**  

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of the journey! You will be part of building great services and outstanding products, all the while nurturing your own professional growth and development.


We offer a unique and dynamic work environment that combines the stability of an established organization with the innovation and opportunities of a start-up venture. Thrive alongside exceptional colleagues in a warm, fun, and challenging atmosphere, while enjoying a great benefits package from our collective bargaining agreement within the SEB Group.

**Application**  

We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis after the holidays.

title: Senior Tech Management Consultant
description:
Join our expanding company and help great Swedish organizations unlock the value of technology and ensure improved business value. We offer services in tech management & governance, IT and solution architecture, cloud optimization, core business systems and automation technologies. Our team is composed of innovative and forward-thinking professionals who are dedicated to achieving excellence where we combine technology capabilities with a human centric approach.


We are looking senior IT and Tech transformation professional with extensive experience in driving technology transformation projects, with a focus on either core system technologies, IT strategy and governance, cloud optimization, or automation technologies


**Your Role:**


* Lead projects / programs / teams in various IT transformation for our clients within your niche IT specialization area
* Drive IT transformation ensuring alignment with business requirements and best practices.
* Provide strategic advice and expertise to clients in IT strategic strategy areas within your technology specialisation focus
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams during IT transformations
* Stay current with industry trends, the latest developments in IT and emerging technologies to continuously enhance service delivery.
* Manage and mentor junior consultants, fostering their professional development and ensuring high-quality project delivery.
* Lead business development activities and sales opportunities to find new assignments, projects and team deliveries for Influence Tech and your colleagues
* Be involved in the expansion and develop of our company as a whole, getting involved if our Practice areas, developing offerings, and recruitment

**Your Profile:**


* 10+ years of proven experience in Tech management consulting leading IT transformations, technology assessments and strategy, and IT System implementation and selection
* Experience of leading deliveries, such as ERP implementations
* Experience and flexibility to take on different roles, such Program and Project manager, Technology lead, IT Specialist and IT Strategy lead
* A proven track record of consulting business development and sales, and developing customer relationships
* Have extensive experience in one of the follow capability areas;
* IT Strategy and technology assessments
* Core systems (eg. ERP) expertise and business alignment
* Automation technologies
* Enterprise and IT System Architecture
* IT Management and Governance
* Cloud optimization
* Knowledge and interest in AI technologies is a benefit
* Strong understanding of business processes and the ability to align technology solutions with business objectives
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with clients and team members.
* Fluent Swedish and English is essential to be able to work with our customers

**What we can offer:**


* The opportunity to work with our experienced leadership team to grow our company and work with customer development
* The opportunity to work on fantastic projects in small teams, in the areas of IT core system implementation, technology strategy, planning and assessments, automation of business processes, cloud optimization, IT landscape assessments, and IT governance improvements
* You will be able to focus on innovative tech projects at some of the most well recognised brands/companies in Sweden.
* You get to work alongside some of the most well-respected tech management consultants in the sector, and to learn from each other.
* To work in a flat hierarchal company with a focus on other things than administration and internal processes.
* To work within a company that thrives on work/life balance
* The opportunity to learn, understand and utilise Collective Intelligence to affect change, transformation and collaboration in a more effective way.

**About us:**


Influence Tech is an exciting Tech Management Consulting company based in Stockholm. We are expanding further, and we want to meet you who want to be involved in shaping Influence Tech. We want to give our customers maximum value and are not afraid to test new ways of thinking to build a wonderful and warm culture with us. You who apply to us are passionate about creating value for our customers, you are alert and take the initiative to make a difference.


Influence Tech is part of the Newground Alliance, an alliance with twelve niche consulting companies totaling 300+ consultants. Our common motto is "Consulting Done Right", and this means that we want to create valuable and sustainable results for our customers and at the same time care about the well-being of everyone in the team.


We review applications continuously and look forward to your application!


#InfluenceTech

title: Machine Learning Engineer 100% remote OK
description:
Looking for a Principal Machine Learning Engineer.  

  

Daily Tasks  

* Design and develop and review advanced machine learning models and architectures, including deep learning, optimization, and generative AI systems
* Lead complex AI/ML project initiatives, providing technical guidance and architectural oversight to cross-functional engineering teams
* Conduct in-depth research and experimentation to evaluate emerging AI technologies, assess their potential applications, and develop proof-of-concept solutions
* Review and optimize existing AI systems for performance, scalability, and efficiency, implementing advanced techniques like model compression and transfer learning
* Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical AI strategies and implementation roadmaps


Minimum Technical Skills  

* Expert-level proficiency in Python, with deep understanding of machine learning libraries
* Advanced knowledge of machine learning algorithms, neural network architectures, and AI model development
* Extensive experience with cloud platforms (must have GCP, nice to have Azure) and AI/ML cloud services
* Strong background in statistical modeling, data preprocessing, and feature engineering
* Proficiency in big data technologies and distributed computing frameworks
* Demonstrated ability to design and implement scalable machine learning infrastructure


Leadership and Experience Level  

* Minimum of 8-10 years of professional experience in AI/ML engineering
* Proven track record of leading complex AI initiatives from conception to production
* Senior technical leadership experience, capable of mentoring junior engineers and driving technical strategy
* Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Demonstrated innovation in AI research or practical applications

title: Senior Project Manager
description:
**Assignment description**


For our client we are looking for **Senior Project Manager**.

**Role Overview:**


The Technical Project Leader will play a pivotal role in our initiatives, specifically Smart Store and Store Tech Uplift programs. This individual will oversee the technical roll-out projects, ensuring seamless integration of advanced infrastructure and network solutions within stores. The consultant will also coordinate with various stakeholders to maintain alignment and achieve project objectives.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop comprehensive project plans for the roll-out of store infrastructure and network capabilities.
* Lead cross-functional teams, including regional representatives, vendors, and central program teams.
* Ensure timely delivery of milestones and address potential roadblocks proactively.
* Act as the central point of contact between regional teams, suppliers, and the central program office.
* Facilitate regular meetings to align goals, expectations, and updates across all involved parties.
* Manage and resolve conflicts or challenges in collaboration with stakeholders.
* Ensure all infrastructure and network deployments meet technical and operational requirements.
* Oversee quality assurance during and after deployments to guarantee performance standards are met.
* Collaborate with technical experts to validate designs and deployment strategies.
* Drive the execution of Smart Store and Store Tech Uplift programs in alignment with business goals.
* Ensure compliance with company policies, industry regulations, and best practices.
* Report on progress, budget utilization, and key metrics to senior management.

  

**Key Qualifications:**

* Minimum 10 years of experience in technical project management roles, preferably in retail or similar sectors.
* Proven expertise in infrastructure and network rollout projects at scale.
* Strong understanding of infrastructure and networking technologies, including PoE devices, VLANs, and IP-based systems.
* Familiarity with Smart Store concepts and technologies.
* Knowledge of Edge Compute technologies and their applications in retail environments.
* Exceptional ability to lead and motivate diverse teams in a complex environment.
* Strong decision-making and problem-solving capabilities.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Swedish and English.
* Proficient in preparing and delivering presentations to stakeholders at all levels.
* A proactive mindset with a focus on results.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.
* Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* High attention to detail with a strategic vision.

**Required cloud certification:** AZ900

**Required skills:** VLAN, Edge Compute technologies, IP-based systems, Smart Store, Project Management, PoE devices

**Languages:** English(Proficient)

 **Location:** Stockholm, Sweden.

**Duration:** Initial contract for 6 months with potential for extension based on performance and project needs.

**Start Date:** Immediate or as soon as possible.

**Deadline Date:** 2024-12-19

title: Power Electronics Engineer till kund
description:
**Tog du nyligen en civilingenjörsexamen inom elektronik och vill arbeta med kraftelektronik (Power Electronics) ? Vår kund söker nu en nyexaminerad civilingenjör med intresse för utveckling av HVDC-teknologier.** **Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv.**

 **Att jobba med Power Electronics hos kund**  

  

I detta talangprogram kommer du som High Voltage Power Electronics Valve Development Engineer få chansen att fokusera på utveckling av HVDC-teknologier för att möjliggöra långdistansöverföring av elektricitet, inklusive förnybar energi. Arbetsuppgifterna inkluderar elektriska beräkningar, simuleringar, kraftelektronikstester, samt samarbete med tvärfunktionella team.

  

Rollen innebär att utföra beräkningar och simuleringar för att analysera elektrisk belastning på komponenter samt specificera och genomföra kraftelektroniktester i samarbete med testavdelningen eller externa testanläggningar. Du arbetar i tvärfunktionella team för att utveckla nya teknologier, hantera risker och dokumentera resultat i tekniska rapporter och presentationer. Uppgifterna utförs i enlighet med kundens kärnvärden för säkerhet och integritet.

  

Rollen är placerad i **Ludvika.**

 **Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent**

Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos kund i Ludvika med start i januari. Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet, men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.


Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos kund samt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos kund.

 **Vi söker dig som:**

  

* Är i början av din karriär och har en civilingenjörsexamen inom elektronik (Power Electronics)
* Har ett intresse för beräkningar, simuleringar, kraftelektronik
* Som person är driven, initiativtagande och kommunikativ
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Har goda kunskaper i Matlab och Comsol

 **Ansökan**

  

Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Olivia Holm på olivia.holm@nexergroup.com.


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

 **Om Nexer Tech Talent**

*Nexer Tech Talent är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 2500 medarbetare i 15 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt. Läs mer om Nexer Tech Talent* *här**.*

title: Sr. GTM Specialist – HPC Europe North
description:
Solid GTM, Sales, or Consulting experience
  
**Technology domain expertise:** High Performance Compute (HPC)
  
Exceptional interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills with experience communicating to technical and non-technical audiences.
  
Established track record of credibility as a technology advisor with customer executives (e.g. CEO, COO, CIO, CTO, CMO) and Line of Business Leaders.
  
Experience and success in negotiating complex deals with customers and partners.
  
  

Are you a customer-obsessed builder with a passion for helping customers achieve their full potential? Do you have the business savvy, High Performance Compute (HPC) background, and skills necessary to help position AWS as the cloud provider of choice for customers? Do you love building new strategic and data-driven businesses? Join the Worldwide Specialist Organization (WWSO) Core Services and Advanced Compute team as a Business Development Specialist!
  
  

The Worldwide Specialist Organization (WWSO) is part of AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS), which is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. We work backwards from our customers’ most complex and business critical problems to build and execute go-to- market plans that turn AWS ideas into multi-billion-dollar businesses. WWSO teams include business development, specialist and technical solutions architecture. As part of WWSO, you'll provide expertise across the entire life cycle of an AWS customer initiative, from developing ideas for new services to accelerating the adoption of established businesses. We pride ourselves on thinking big, delivering exceptional results for our customers, and working across AWS as #OneTeam.
  
  

Within WWSO, this position is a part of the Go-To-Market (GTM) Specialist team, where you will lead GTM strategy for High Performance Compute (HPC) for Europe North. We create sales plays, leverage partners, and build new initiatives that drive results for our customers. We provide critical feedback from customers to inform our product roadmap, and work closely with our partner network to build an ecosystem supporting our customers’ goals. In emerging areas, we play a critical role as the “first in” teams to build markets for new services, domains, or solutions. When a customer needs to innovate and requires a new way to leverage AWS, they count on us to innovate with them to build and deliver what they need.
  
  

AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
Own the GTM strategy and execution for High Performance Compute (HPC) in Europe North, collaborating with teams in the field including Sales, Partners, Marketing, and other Specialists.
  
Leverage your deep expertise in High Performance Compute (HPC) to understand the most important customer problems in your region and enable account aligned teams in the field to solve them.
  
Lead cross-functional initiatives to expand markets/accounts, develop scalable programs to drive adoption, and identify new opportunities within your domain.
  
Develop and execute goals to drive long term growth in your geography, while meeting/exceeding revenue and non-revenue driven KPI’s.
  
Bring customer data and market signals back to Worldwide teams to ensure we are prioritizing the building of the right features and services for our customers.
  
Delivering monthly/quarterly business reviews and operational planning documents for your respective tech domain and geography.
  
Drive geographical scale through external partners; Partner with cross functional teams across Solution Architecture, Business Development, Marketing, Partners, and Training and execute customer acquisition programs and strategies.
  
  

A day in the life
  
Diverse Experiences
  
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  
  

Why AWS
  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
  
  

Work/Life Balance
  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  
  

Inclusive Team Culture
  
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
  
  

Mentorship and Career Growth
  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  
  

Experience in a heavily matrixed sales environment, including developing, implementing, managing, and executing go-to-market growth initiatives and sales motions.
  
Deep understanding of cloud technologies, including public and hybrid cloud platforms.
  
Technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus.
  
  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
  
  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
