title: Sales Operations Analyst
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring Sales Operations Analysts to join a team of experts who help Canonical sales teams achieve their business goals. The Sales Operations team drives continuous process and data quality improvement to ensure orders are processed correctly. The successful candidate will be a leader who shows initiative in improving the way the team works, maintaining compliance and associated governance.
   

  

 The success of the role is measured against increasing the velocity of deals and the quality of Customer Relationship Management (CRM) data used to drive key business decisions. The ideal candidate will be a proactive problem solver and team player who is passionate about the opportunity to partner with sales leadership, is also passionate about our role in the technology industry bringing open source to a wider audience of innovators and enterprises, and will design and drive programs in support of Canonical's continued success.
   

  

**Location:** 
*This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.*
 The role entails
   

  

* Support all aspects of the day-to-day operations of the sales function globally
* Review opportunities for accuracy and provision orders on successful closure of a deal
* Support the Sales Operations Manager to improve sales data quality and processes
* Report on data quality metrics to executive level stakeholders
* Implement surveys and define metrics for executive level stakeholders
* Support the sales team globally on CRM and other sales operations systems
* Deliver sales metrics, dashboards and other ad-hoc analytical tasks
* Lead automation and streamline the Lead to Order process


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from high school and university
* Experience in a sales operations/sales order processing role
* Experience in a technology subscription-based business
* Experience driving data quality improvement
* Energetic, thoughtful, systematic approach, focused on robust, repeatable and scalable outcomes
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
* Ability to work productively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization on a global scale
* Ability to manage across boundaries and communicate effectively, particularly working with Sales, Legal, Finance and Marketing teams
* Experience with Salesforce or similar CRM
* Ability to travel internationally twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long


 What Canonical offers
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

*We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.*

title: Product Owner - Data & Analytics
job_function: Business Development, Marketing, and Product Management
description:
Do you have a strong background of product ownership in the field of Data and Analytics? Are you a true team player who’s flexible and dedicated? Then you could be the right person to join our exciting journey!
   

  

 To strengthen Sandvik Coromant’s Data Office team and our agile, product-centric way of working, we’re looking for a Product Owner for our Data and Analytics offering to our business domain. Joining us in this exciting position, you’re one of the key players in shaping and securing our offering to our whole organization!
   

  

**Your future team**
 The Data Office drives democratization of data, analytics, AI and automation for all Sandvik Coromant teams through self-services, data literacy and data products. We deliver fit-for-purpose solutions, organized in a federated way to ensure predictability and transparency. Our team of experts in data, analytics, AI and automation is driven by a strong engineering spirit and a commitment to teamwork, leading by example in technology and product-driven methodologies.
   

  

**Your mission**
 You take responsibility and ownership for the roadmap and backlog of defined domains – covering data products, features and enablers. To achieve this, you collaborate closely with stakeholders from the business lines, IT and the data office. You’re also responsible for the intake process of requirements, translation into epics, features and stories and together with our Scrum Master, you work to execute the outlined product roadmap for your domains.
   

  

 In this exciting and challenging position, you have the following responsibilities:
   

  

* Perform functional leadership of one or two product teams.
* Management of the domain stakeholders and alignment of priorities and expectations.
* Creation and maintenance of the product roadmaps.
* Being accountable for the backlog.
* Collaborate closely with the data analysts within your product team to secure fit-for-purpose requirements.
* Accountable for a committed timeline within the Now-Next-Later-framework.
* Act as our go-to-person for all stakeholders of the owned domain.
* Accountable for the fulfillment of the definition of done for all epics within owned domains.
* Accountable for the adoption of delivered data, analytics and AI products and all related aspects, such as training, improved prioritization and lifecycle management.


 The location for this position is Sandviken or Stockholm. We offer you a hybrid work solution.
   

  

**Your Experience And Skills**
* A minimum of three years’ experience in engineering and technology roles.
* Proven experience in digital and data product lifecycle management (build, adapt, improve and sunset).
* Proven expertise with cloud computing service providers – preferably Microsoft Azure.
* Proven expertise with Lakehouse service providers – preferably Databricks.
* Proven expertise with Scrum and supporting tools like Jira or DevOps.


 Your personality makes all the difference! Embedded in a strong global team, you bring in your experience to shape and develop our offering and products and secure prioritization to balance short-term deliverables with long-term needs. You have a structured way of working and a humble approach. To interact with others energizes you, both internally and externally, and you use your excellent communication skills to create strong relationships.
   

  

**Our culture**
 Innovation is in our DNA and we’re proud to shape the future of manufacturing in close collaboration with our customers and partners. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career opportunities in an inspiring global environment. Meet some of your future colleagues at our career page or visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 Are you curious to know more about this position? Please contact Hanna Thomas, recruitment specialist, hanna.thomas@sandvik.com
   

  

 We have already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use, and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts:
   

  

* Thomas Lilja, Unionen, +46 (0)70-261 04 82
* Göran Norell, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70-616 43 78
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-222 48 55


 Hiring Manager: Philipp Hess
   

  

 At Sandvik Coromant, we value work-life balance and due to the holidays, it may take a little bit longer until we reply in this process.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send your application no later than January 22nd, 2024. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0073957.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

title: PKI-specialist
description:
**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 2025-01-23
 



  





  





*Svenska kraftnät är en av de viktigaste aktörerna för en hållbar energiomställning. Som PKI-specialist erbjuds du ett av Sveriges viktigaste IT-jobb, i vilket du varje dag kommer att bidra till Sveriges elförsörjning. Vi behöver dig för att lyckas med vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag att elektrifiera Sverige.* 




  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Svenska kraftnät befinner sig i en expansiv och kritisk fas, där de bygger upp en helt ny infrastruktur. Som PKI-specialist får du möjligheten att forma hela PKI-området – från grunden. Du kommer att utveckla lösningar med hög säkerhetsnivå och medvetenhet, där ditt arbete gör skillnad för hela Sveriges energiframtid.
 



  





 Du kommer till ett erfaret och engagerat team och kommer få arbeta i en stor och mycket komplex IT-miljö, med egen kontroll över drift och utveckling av alla lager av infrastrukturen. Du kommer spela en nyckelroll i att säkra elförsörjningen och stärka motståndet mot angrepp.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter** 



* Sätta struktur och övergripande design för PKI-området – från grunden(!)
* Kravställning, utveckling och förvaltning av de nya PKI-lösningarna
* Installation, konfiguration och dokumentation av HSM
* Utveckla, underhålla och administrera digital certifikathantering
* Ta fram policydokument kopplade till PKI och processbeskrivningar för dess hantering
* Bidra i utvecklingsarbetet mot virtualiserade och automatiserade tjänster



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi söker dig som är självgående och har en god förmåga att ta egna initiativ. Du bör kunna ta dig an ett övergripande perspektiv och det är viktigt att du hela tiden ser till helheten. Vidare ser vi att du har en god förmåga att bygga relationer och kommunicera med olika intressenter på alla nivåer för att framgångsrikt styra arbetet, visualisera målbilden och få med dig andra på vägen framåt.
 



  





 Skallkrav:
 


* Flerårig erfarenhet av installation och administration av PKI-system
* Erfarenhet av att sätta struktur för uppbyggnad av PKI
* Relevant utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt som vi bedömer är likvärdig.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och i skrift



  





 Meriterande erfarenhet:
 


* Hardware Security Module (HSM)
* Lösningsarkitektur och design av PKI-lösningar
* PKI-system i Linuxmiljöer
* KMIP
* Utveckla, underhålla och administrera digital certifikathantering
* Processutveckling för hantering av digitala certifikats livscykel
* Arkitektur och implementation av infrastruktur för säker kryptonyckelförvaring/hantering
* Även certifieringar inom IT-säkerhet eller IT-arkitektur är meriterande



  





**Bra att veta** 



* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg (Stockholm)
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 % #LI-hybrid
* Sista ansökningsdag är
 **2025-01-23** 
 . Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i samband med din ansökan.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med ev. beredskap



  





 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Svenska kraftnät med IDG Recruitment. Vid frågor, kontakta rekryteringskonsult Alexandra Tihinen,
 **alexandra.tihinen@foundryco.com** 
 , 070-447 92 24, alternativt Maria Sahlén rekryterare hos Svenska kraftnät,
 **maria.sahlen2@svk.se** 
 , 010-489 20 27.
 



  





 Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim, ST, tel. 010-475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post:
 **fornamn.efternamn@svk.se** 
 .
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
 



  





**För mer information om säkerhetsprövning** 
 Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss:
 **Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät**

title: Sales Specialist
description:
*Är du vårt nya Sales Specialist med fokus på nykundsbearbeting?*
****Om jobbet 💻📱****
 I rollen som Sales Specialist blir du en nyckelspelare till vårt team i Stockholm. Ditt huvuduppdrag är att driva nykundsbearbetningen i SME/MM-segmentet (20-350 anställda) och vara med kunden hela vägen till signerat avtal. Alla kunder ser olika ut, har olika behov & önskemål och komplexiteten i affärerna är således väldigt varierande.
   

  

 Du förväntas, på ett strukturerat, datadrivet och kundorienterat sätt, bearbeta beslutsfattare för att skapa nya affärsmöjligheter från första prospektering, bokat möte och hela vägen till färdigt avtal. Därefter lämnar du över kunden till vårt grymma Customer Success team som ansvarar för implementering och värdeskapande under avtalstiden.
   

  

 Du arbetar med en av telco-marknadens bästa produkter och genom värdebaserad försäljning löser du kundens problem på allra bästa sätt!
   

  

***Läs gärna mer om Telavox och Gabriel, som är rekryterande chef i denna rekrytering här: Meet the Telavoxer***
**Om dig 🌟**
 För att lyckas (och trivas!) i denna roll har du några års erfarenhet av uppsökande försäljning och affärsutveckling där du är van vid att prospektera och proaktivt kontakta kunder.
   

  

 Du drivs av att hitta nya försäljningsmöjligheter, både kalla & varma, och är således inte rädd för att lyfta luren! Du har även ett stort intresse för teknik, samt en förståelse för vad som är värdeskapande för både din kund och dig själv.
   

  

**Vidare Ser Vi Gärna Att Du Har**
* Erfarenhet från samma eller närliggande bransch (Telecom, SaaS och/eller IT)
* Erfarenhet från att jobba datadrivet och modernt med hjälp av CRM-system - vi arbetar i HubSpot
* Goda kommunikations-skills - i både svenska och engelsk


 Som person är du nyfiken och har ett driv att ständigt lära dig nya saker och bygga nya relationer - både internt och externt! Vi tror att att ha roligt på jobbet är nyckeln till framgång, och vill fortsätta växa med nya kollegor som bidrar med nya perspektiv och massor av positiv energi!
   

  

**Om Telavox 💚**
 Vi är en snabbväxande mobiloperatör för företag som revolutionerar hur företag kommunicerar och interagerar med kunder. Vår egenutvecklade plattform samlar telefoni, växel och ärendehantering i en app som är enkel att använda och integrera med kringliggande system. Genom att äga och utveckla vår teknologi själva har vi friheten att skapa den bästa upplevelsen för våra kunder – och det är precis vad vi gör.
   

  

 Sedan starten för ca 20 år sedan har vi vuxit till 500 anställda i 9 länder. Hos oss får du vara en del av ett roligt och föränderligt bolag med alla möjligheter till utveckling och att bidra till vår framgång!
   

  

**Är du intresserad av att bli en del av Telavox? Ansök nu! 💌**
 Vi ser verkligen fram emot att höra från dig! Skicka din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Om det finns några frågor, vänligen kontakta vår rekryterare, Hanna Lindkvist, på hanna.lindkvist@telavox.com.
   

  

 Telavox develops world-leading communications platforms with solutions for smart and efficient telephony, PBX, chat and much more. Regardless of whether it involves an entrepreneur-driven startup or a giant among giants, Telavox contributes to making companies more transparent, efficient and accessible.

title: Regional Account Executive ESG data for Real Estate - Nordics market
description:
***Deepki, leading the way in ESG for real estate owners and accelerating the transition towards net zero and sustainability***
 Deepki, a rapidly growing SaaS company headquartered in Paris, is extending its presence into the
 **Nordics** 
 . We are seeking a
 **Senior Account Executive** 
 to lead this expansion and cultivate new sales opportunities across the existing and potential client base in the Nordics region.
   

  

**As a Senior Account Executive for the Nordics, your primary responsibilities will include:**
* Collaborating with the Sales Team to implement the sales strategy and priorities tailored to the Nordics market.
* Establishing yourself as a trusted Deepki advisor in the region, promoting our products and services, and understanding the unique challenges, ambitions, and ongoing needs of prospective clients.
* Managing the complete sales cycle, including lead generation and qualification, RFPs, pitch documents, contract negotiations, deal closures, and managing upsell opportunities.
* Achieving and surpassing sales targets through the conversion of qualified leads.
* Creating customer-facing presentations and leading product demonstrations, both online and in person.
* Preparing and managing pricing proposals for prospective clients.
* Developing contract deliverables in collaboration with clients and engaging internal stakeholders as needed.
* Ensuring a seamless transition from closing the sale to client onboarding, including participating in onboarding calls.
* Undertaking any other duties assigned as the role evolves within our new and ambitious team focused on the Nordics.


**Other** 
 :
   

  

* Apply the internal information systems security policy
* Report all security incidents
* Apply operating procedures


**To be successful in this role, you should possess the following:**
* A minimum of 4-5 years of experience in sales-related roles within B2B SaaS companies, large software companies, or cloud solutions.
* A customer-centric approach, with the ability to establish and maintain relationships with stakeholders at all levels within client organisations.
* A proven track record in building, managing, and converting large sales pipelines.
* Demonstrable success in securing complex, enterprise-level accounts in the Nordics market.
* Experience with the Real Estate market
* The ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.
* Excellent proficiency in written and spoken English and one or more Nordic languages (Swedish, Danish, Norwegian, Finnish) is a must
* An open-minded, self-starting attitude with a strong sense of ambition, curiosity, and a goal-oriented approach.
* A genuine interest in real estate and environmental issues.
* Experience with CRM tools.


**Why join Deepki?**
 Deepki’s teams are dedicated to making an impact by harnessing data to transform the world’s most carbon-intensive industry into a force for good for the planet, and creating virtuous real estate. They embody our four core values: drive, commitment, righteousness, and goodwill, which represent a fundamental element of life at Deepki.
   

  

 Our employees are at the heart of everything we do, and we strive to provide a comfortable environment where they can flourish.
   

  

 In the UK we offer:
   

  

* Remote working days - hybrid model
* 25 Days Leave + Public Holidays
* Health & Dental Insurance (from Day 1)
* Income Protection
* Life Cover & Pension Plan (from Day 1)
* 12 weeks Maternity leave, including 6 weeks paid 100% by Deepki
* Onboarding & Advanced Training in Paris
* Annual Off-site Meeting in Paris
* In-house training
* International environment
* Access to a language learning platform
* Dynamic and passionate ecosystem where everyone's initiatives have their place


**More About Deepki**
 Founded in 2014, Deepki supports real estate players in their transition to net zero and sustainability. To achieve this transition towards sustainability, Deepki helps realign stakeholders’ interests to build efficient strategies and transform real estate into a positive force for the planet.
   

  

 Deepki is the only company in the world offering a fully-populated ESG data intelligence platform combined with expert advisory services. The company’s end-to-end solutions leverage data to improve ESG performance and maximize the value of real estate assets.
   

  

 Deepki has offices across Europe, in Paris, London, Madrid, Milan, and Berlin, with ambitious expansion plans.
   

  

**Key Figures**
* 400M+ square meters monitored
* 60+ countries where we operate
* 400+ references across the world
* 400+ employees globally
* 216K+ tCO2e saved by our customers each year


 We are looking for talented individuals that share our drive and motivation to accelerate
 *real estate’s environmental transition at an international scale!*
*Our team represents a mixture of different backgrounds and experiences, working together to ensure the best possible customer experience. We pride ourselves on our employees’ openness and curiosity. Joining Deepki means becoming a team player, being willing to learn and giving a purpose to your work!*
*Do you feel like you meet most requirements, but not all of them? We want to hear from you!*
*Deepki is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, passion, merit, and business need.*

title: Systemarkitekt för Beslutsstöd
description:
*Till vårt huvudkontor i centrala Stockholm söker vi nu en Systemarkitekt. Vi söker dig som vill arbeta med och har erfarenhet av modern teknik inom datalager och beslutsstöd och som vill bidra till att främja folkhälsan och miljön.* 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Systemarkitekt för Beslutsstöd blir du en del av vårt verksamhetsområde Transformation & Digitalisering på enheten Digital Utveckling & Förvaltning. Enhetens uppdrag är att i nära samarbete med verksamheten och leverantörer ansvara för förvaltning och utveckling utav några av Systembolagets mest centrala IT-stöd.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder dig möjlighet att jobba med modern teknik inom datalager och beslutsstöd. En chans att vara med och utforma framtidens plattform för Analys och AI.
 



  





 Du kommer att arbeta i ett engagerat team med sex medarbetare och rapporterar direkt till Gruppchef Johan Oinonen.
 



  





 Idag har Systembolaget en Beslutsstödslösning baserad på Microsofts produktsvit med datalagret realiserat i SQL Server och analyslagret realiserat med en kombination av multidimensionella kuber, tabulära modeller och rapporter där en del av de nyare tillskotten ligger i Azure. Vi har påbörjat en resa mot en modern, funktionell beslutsstödslösning där vi bland annat utvärderar Microsoft Fabric och vi ser att du kommer att vara en viktig del i det arbetet.
 



  





**I din roll som** 
 Systemarkitekt för Beslutsstöd kommer du framför allt att arbeta med:
 


* Ansvara för våra lösningar inom datalager och beslutsstöd.
* Säkerställa optimal kvalitet i teknisk lösning och att arkitekturen följer Systembolagets övergripande arkitekturella principer.
* Leda lösningsarbetet både vid ny- och vidareutveckling.
* Leda livscykelplaneringen och implementationen av nästa generations Beslutsstöd.
* Upprätthålla en aktuell bild av nuläge och arkitekturell målbild.
* Bidra med kunskapsspridning, rådgivning och stöd.
* Problemarbete och ständiga förbättringar



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi söker dig som har:
 


* Högskoleutbildning inom relevant område t.ex. Data- och Systemvetenskap eller Datateknik
* Djup kunskap om, och flera års erfarenhet av att jobba med, lösningar inom datalager och beslutsstöd i en liknade roll i en större IT-verksamhet.



  





 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har arbetat med:
 


* Microsoft SQL Server
* Datamodellering
* Molnbaserade dataplattformar
* Integrationsarkitektur
* Agil utvecklingsmetodik t.ex. SAFe
* Systemutveckling, gärna inom beslutsstödsdomänen
* Microsoft Azure (Analysis Services, Data Factory, SQL, SSAS etc.)
* Power BI
* AI och Machine learning



  





 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen tror vi att du som person har ett flexibelt förhållningsätt, en nyfiken inställning till att lära nytt samt har ett intresse av de möjligheter som moderna digitala verktyg skapar. Att skapa goda relationer och ha ett öppet förhållningssätt till alla du möter värdesätts högt hos oss.
 



  





 Du är analytiskt lagd, van att tänka kritiskt, är självgående i ditt arbete och har ett starkt personligt ledarskap. Du har god samarbetsförmåga och är van att arbeta i grupp. Du är kommunikativ och har lätt för att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift, på både svenska och engelska.
 



 I urvalet kommer vi att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Vad vi står för och hur vi jobbar** 




 Genom vår ansvarsfulla försäljning vill vi bidra till bättre folkhälsa och en hållbar utveckling för både människor och miljö. Vi vill upplevas omtänksamma, kunniga och inspirerande i allt vi gör. Våra värderingar hjälper oss att lyckas med Systembolagets viktiga uppdrag.
 



  





 Systembolaget utvecklas ständigt och det kommer du också att göra. För oss är det viktigt att vi som jobbar här mår bra och att vi skapar balans mellan arbete, familj och fritid. Vi tror starkt på långsiktighet både ur ett socialt och hållbart perspektiv. Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss.
 



  





  





**Känns rollen rätt för dig?** 




 Kul! Varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan med CV så snart som möjligt. För att kunna göra en rättvis och likvärdig bedömning av dig som sökande använder vi oss av urvalsfrågor. I ansökningsformuläret kommer du få svara på ett antal frågor om din kompetens och erfarenhet för rollen. Vi kommer att påbörja urval efter sista ansökningsdatum. Webbaserade tester och bakgrundskontroll kommer att vara en del i slutfasen av rekryteringsprocessen.
 



  





**Bra att veta** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och inleds med 6 månaders provanställning. Vårt mål är att spegla samhället och vi arbetar aktivt för att främja mångfald och säkerställa likabehandling. Vi välkomnar medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser för att skapa en inkluderande arbetsplats där alla har möjlighet att utvecklas och bidra. Som anställd hos oss på Systembolaget får du ta del av konkurrenskraftiga förmåner såsom, lunch- och friskvårdsbidrag, bra pensions- och semestervillkor.
 



  





**Kontakt** 




 Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Välkommen att kontakta Gruppchef, Johan Oinonen på 070-614 00 43.
 



  





**Välkommen att arbeta hos oss på Systembolaget, ett av Sveriges starkaste varumärken som med omtanke ger service i världsklass!** 




 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_
 



 Systembolaget finns till för alla i Sverige för att bidra till bättre folkhälsa genom att begränsa alkoholens skador. Vi bidrar med kunskap och oberoende rådgivning om mat och dryck och hur alkohol påverkar hälsan. På så vis vill vi inspirera till medvetna dryckesval och ett hälsosammare förhållningssätt till alkohol där varken människor eller miljön tar skada. Läs mer om oss på omsystembolaget.se.

title: Partneransvarig
description:
Partneransvarig till världens största terränglopp!
 



  





 Var med och skapa oförglömliga upplevelser för tiotusentals löpare! Sök en av idrottssveriges mest spännande tjänster för dig som brinner för folkhälsa, löparglädje och vill bidra till fantastiska minnen för löparna i Lidingöloppets olika lopp under året. Tillsammans med ett starkt team runt omkring dig kommer du att utveckla och driva hela Lidingöloppets produktportfölj. Vill du arbeta i en dynamisk roll där du får möjligheten att sälja in, utveckla och driva strategiska partnerskap? Vi söker nu en Partneransvarig som vill vara med och skapa tillväxt och framgång för Lidingöloppet genom nya och befintliga samarbeten.
 



  





**Arbetsbeskrivning** 




 Som Partneransvarig kommer du att spela en central roll i att skapa värde för såväl organisationen som för våra löpare och våra partners. Du ansvarar för att identifiera nya möjligheter, sälja in nya partnerskap, bygga långsiktiga relationer och säkerställa att våra partnerskap är framgångsrika.
 



 I rollen som Partneransvarig kommer dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter bestå av:
 


* Identifiera företag som kan vara potentiella partners till Lidingöloppet och sälja in loppet till dessa
* Utveckla och driva strategiska partnerskap, från första kontakt till uppföljning
* Skapa skräddarsydda lösningar som möter partners behov och mål.
* Planera och genomföra gemensamma aktiviteter för Lidingöloppets partners
* Ansvara för avtal, budget och uppföljning av partnerskapets resultat
* Representera Lidingöloppet vid externa möten, event och nätverksträffar



  





 Partneransvarig rapporterar direkt till Lidingöloppets Generalsekreterare. Du arbetar i nära samarbete med ytterligare en Partneransvarig, Försäljnings- och Marknadschef, samt andra i organisationen. På Lidingöloppets sportkontor arbetar idag 15 personer men under loppen ökar organisationen med både eventpersonal och ideella funktionärer.
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker dig som har relevant eftergymnasial utbildning och ett flertal års erfarenhet som Partneransvarig eller liknande roll. Du har tydligt intresse och känsla för försäljning av sponsring och partnerskap, och har en mycket god förmågan att driva, sälja och få avslut på dina affärer. Det är en fördel om du redan idag har ett brett kontaktnät bland företag och potentiella partners.
 



 Du har ett starkt intresse för upplevelser, folkhälsa och idrott, och det är positivt om du är involverad i någon förening där du har haft funktionärsuppdrag eller liknande.
 



 Som person ser vi att du är affärsmässig, kundfokuserad och resultat- och målinriktad. Du har en mycket god förmåga att bygga relationer och trivs i en roll där du får driva försäljning och utveckling. Du trivs både med att arbeta självständigt och i grupp. Du arbetar strukturerat och metodiskt. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du en hög social kompetens, engagemang och ett stort mått av initiativtagande. Du är nyfiken, bl a på nya tekniker för att effektivisera och underlätta för dig i vardagen. Du arbetar i flera olika system och program. Du har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
 



  





**Om Lidingöloppet﻿** 




 TCS Lidingöloppet är världens största terränglopp och arrangeras på Lidingö den sista helgen i september. Loppet är en del av En svensk klassiker tillsammans med Vasaloppet, Engelbrektsloppet, Vätternrundan och Vansbrosimningen. Sedan 1965 har de 30 kuperade kilometerna på Lidingö varit en lockande utmaning för löpare från både Sverige och andra länder, och det finns även flera andra distanser liksom lopp för knattar, barn och personer med funktionsvariationer. Lidingöloppet arrangerar också, utöver TCS Lidingösloppshelgen, lopp under hela året för både bredd- och elitlöpare. Vår vision är att få flera människor att röra på sig oavsett ålder, kön, bakgrund och förutsättningar. Lidingöloppet ägs och drivs av idrottsföreningarna IFK Lidingö Friidrott och IFK Lidingö Skid- och Orienteringsklubb. Allt överskott från loppen går till ungdomsidrotten och föreningslivet.
 



  





**Vad händer nu?** 




 Tjänsten är på heltid och placerad och utgår från Lidingöloppets sportkontor på Lidingö.
 



  





 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Lidingöloppet med Hiroy.
 



  





 Ansök enkelt genom att ladda upp ditt CV och besvara frågorna. När vi har mottagit och granskat din ansökan, och om din profil matchar kravprofilen, kommer du att gå vidare till nästa steg där du får genomföra arbetspsykologiska tester inför intervjun. Har du inte hört något inom tre veckor innebär det troligtvis att du inte gått vidare i processen.

title: Är du vår nästa Analytics Consultant?
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Design Services
description:
Vi letar nu efter fler kollegor till vår växande grupp datakonsulter; personer som gillar att skapa magi genom data & analys!
   

  

 Våra närmare 200 dataexperter jobbar med datalösningar inom nästan alla teknologier, både med och utan cloud. Ett vanligt projekt varierar i längd från en månad till några år, och situationen kan justeras baserat på dina önskemål. Våra kunder finns inom alla branscher, allt från produktutveckling, hälsa, industri och försäkring till kommunikation, bank och elförsörjning.
   

  

 Såhär beskriver vår Viz-konsult Alexandra sitt nuvarande projekt:
   

  

 “Jag hjälper kunden att utveckla en app för att följa upp kostnader i stora projekt, för att se till att man ligger i linje med budgeten och fakturerar enligt plan. Mitt uppdrag hos kunden kommer att breddas framöver då jag nyligen hjälpt till att göra en kartläggning av Power BI-behov i hela verksamheten. Vi har bland annat hittat behov inom kvalitet och hållbarhetsredovisning – vilket jag tycker är extra spännande då det knyter an till mitt intresse för området. Det bästa med uppdraget är samarbetet – jag är del av ett Scrum-team bestående av bolagets egna it-medarbetare och användare. Det är också tryggt att ha Solitas community i ryggen, jag vet att jag aldrig är ensam, det finns alltid hjälp att få av kollegorna”
   

  

**Känner du igen dig i följande?**
* Du diskuterar gärna datavisualiseringar och databaser, och bygger inspirerande dashboards
* Du kan implementera datalösningar som fungerar både för dataexperter och beslutsfattare på företag
* Du lär dig gärna nya teknologier och metoder
* Du har över två års erfarenhet med Tableau, Power BI och SQL
* Du är intresserad och nyfiken av teknologier och data


 Det viktigaste för oss är ändå att du delar våra värderingar, du är omtänksam mot andra och delar gärna din kunskap och vågar stå för det du tror på. Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss, och vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete, och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

**På Solita Får Du**
* Projekt som skapar riktiga avtryck, både hos kunder och i samhället
* Nya teknologier
* En arbetskultur med hög självständighet och tillit
* Variation: i projekt, i teknologier, i angreppsätt
* Personlig utveckling och möjligheten att lära sig både från erfarna experter och våra interna utbildningssatsningar och communities
* Konkurrenskraftig, fast lön i kombination med bl.a. 30 semesterdagar, fredagsfrukostar, aw:s, bike leasing, inhouse coach, yoga på kontoret, och pensionsavsättningar även under din föräldraledighet


 Blev du nyfiken? Hör av dig till oss!
   

  

***Solita är ett nordiskt företag som jobbar med digital transformation, styrd av data och mänsklig expertis. Vi har kontor i Sverige, Finland, Tyskland, Estland, Belgien och Danmark.***

title: Machine Learning Engineer - ML Planning
description:
RaySearch develops innovative software solutions to improve cancer care. About 1000 clinics in more than 40 countries use RaySearch software to improve treatments and quality of life for patients. RaySearch was founded in 2000 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. The headquarters is located in Stockholm, with subsidiaries in the US, Europe, Asia and Australia & New Zealand. Today we are more than 380 employees with a common vision of improving cancer care with innovative software. Our great staff is crucial for our success and we offer a fantastic working environment in modern offices, flexibility and good opportunities for development. We believe in equal opportunities, value diversity and work actively to prevent discrimination.
RaySearch is expanding in the field of machine learning to improve cancer care and is looking for a machine learning engineer to join our head office in Stockholm. Joining our team provides you with a unique opportunity to innovate and develop software that improves the lives of cancer patients around the world.


**About the position**
----------------------



You will be part of an agile team developing innovative solutions using machine learning (ML) algorithms to automate and support the process of improving future cancer treatments.



As a member of the ML Planning team, you will develop deep learning models for medical image analysis to be deployed at cancer clinics, helping them automating their treatment planning process. You will work closely with medical physicists and radiation oncologists and you'll incorporate their domain expertise into model architectures and validation approaches.  

  

Your focus will extend beyond initial development to optimization of model performance, balancing prediction accuracy with clinical deployment requirements. You'll implement rigorous testing and validation frameworks to ensure model reliability in clinical settings, while leading code reviews and maintaining high standards for documentation and reproducibility.


**Your profile**
----------------



We think that you are passionate about machine learning techniques and algorithms with a strong drive to develop and assess innovative solutions.
  

We're looking for someone with proven experience developing production-grade ML systems using PyTorch or TensorFlow, and expertise in processing and analyzing image data. Experience with ML deployment pipelines, model serving architectures, and ML experiment tracking tools are a plus.  

Delivering high quality results is something you take pride in, and you thrive in a dynamic and fast paced environment. You are a strong team player who takes responsibility and contributes to a positive atmosphere and you are passionate about developing software for health care professionals and their patients.


**Requirements:**


* Ph.D. or M.Sc. in computer science/machine learning or equivalent
* Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms
* 3+ years’ experience of implementing machine learning solutions
* Strong programming skills in Python
* Experience using deep learning libraries such as TensorFlow or PyTorch
* Solid knowledge of data structures, statistics and applied mathematics
* Experience training deep learning models for computer vision
* Excellent spoken and written communication skills in English


**Meriting:**


* Experience using tools for MLOps
* Experience in healthcare / medtech

**Our Culture**
---------------



Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization**, where** everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability **to deliver** exceptional results, **pay** close attention to detail, and consistently **go** the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in **their** field**, driven by** a relentless focus on solving problems **-** no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in **leading the way in** cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative **solutions** that make a real difference in patient care.


### **Our Offer**



At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.


**Application**
---------------



Apply for the position through the application form below. Please note that we are approaching the holiday season. A response to your application may be delayed until January.

title: Learning Designer for Technical Training
description:
**Learning Designer for Technical Training**
============================================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **This position reports to**


Service Manager

### **Your role and responsibilities**


The L&W Training Centre offers two pillars for training on Lorentzen & Wettre products: Classroom training and self-directed learning, which can be combined to create blended learning. As a learning designer, you develop learning content for different settings. We are looking for applicants with an e-learning background and interest in technical topics. Your tasks include the design and implementation of interactive learning units, technical product training and webinars in modern seminar rooms. Start your career in our international high-tech company! Your area of responsibility • Coordinating and initiating international service certification. • Support of e-learning projects with a technical focus, from idea generation to completion, in various multimedia formats and with different authoring tools. • Collaboration with specialist departments in the conception, design and development of product training. • Creative and target group-oriented preparation of learning content with varied learning formats. • Organizing and supporting classroom, live online training and webinars for customers and employees worldwide. • Rollout of the learning offering to internal and external stakeholders worldwide and further development based on requirements. • Compliance with and further development of our quality standards. • Updating and releasing documents for both internal and external use. • Coordinating and initiating international service certification.

### **Qualifications for the role**

* Relevant training in the field of learning design, e-learning or didactics (Master, certified program, or similar) and at least 3 years of professional experience in this field.
* Technical understanding or affinity for the automation industry.
* Written and spoken English skills, precise linguistic expression and good text comprehension.
* Knowledge of Articulate 360 (Storyline and Rise360) and Adobe Creative Suite is an advantage.
* Experience in training organization and content management in a learning management system.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills as well as the ability to manage projects independently.
* Motivated personality with a well-organized and detail-oriented way of working.

### **More about us**


Lorentzen & Wettre is a unit within Process Automation. We are the global market leader in quality testing and process measurement instruments for the Pulp and Paper industry. We are developing, designing and manufacturing instruments and serving our world-wide customers from our facilities in Kista, Sweden. Our customers are pulp and paper producers all over the world and we are regarded as a partner for them for more than 100 years. Our products include advanced measurement technology, mechanical and electrical design as well as embedded and internet connected software. Recruiting Manager Kenneth Wahlqvist, +46 706 520 967 will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Jannica Åhman, +46 701 84 31 63; Ledarna: Kenneth Wahlqvist, +46 706 52 09 67; Unionen: Joakim Broström, +46 706 70 94 31. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Irma Leijon, +46 724 612 314. We look forward to receiving your application. We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

title: Ultrasonic Sensors System Design Engineer
description:
**Who We Are**
--------------



At Volvo Cars, we are committed to making bold digital visions a reality. We aim to lead the automotive world by creating a connected ecosystem that simplifies our customers' lives while pursuing a Zero Collision future. Our Research & Development (R&D) division for AD and ADAS Platform consists of about 200 dedicated professionals focused on active safety, driver assistance, and collision avoidance functions.


We collaborate closely with various stakeholders, including function owners, software developers, and sensor teams working on LiDARs, cameras, radars, and ultrasonic sensors. Within this innovative environment, we design platforms that include system design, high-level software architecture, software integration, and verification, partnering with top-tier sensor suppliers to drive automotive excellence.


**What You'll Do**
------------------



As a System Design Engineer for Ultrasonic Sensors, you will play a central role in component development. You will design the Ultrasonic Sensor system architecture and define its interfaces to ensure seamless integration with the Core Computing system. You will manage the breakdown of functional and non-functional requirements into modules, components, and interfaces, ensuring they align with technical standards and project goals.


Collaboration will be at the heart of your role, as you’ll coordinate with Solution Architects, sensor suppliers, and sensor fusion teams. You’ll balance evolving platform requirements while considering hardware, software, and system design constraints. Your work will involve adapting to tools like System Weaver, Team Center, and Elektra while maintaining a structured approach to problem-solving and project execution.


**Who You Are**
---------------



You are a passionate and detail-oriented system design professional with a background in electronics, mechatronics, or software development. With more than four years of experience in system design, you have a proven track record in managing complex projects and working with cross-functional teams. Your understanding of system safety standards, including ISO 26262 and Cyber Security principles, strengthens your ability to develop secure and reliable system solutions.


You are technically skilled in tools and protocols like Ethernet, TCP/IP, and CAN, with additional expertise in Python, Simulink, or C/C++. Your strong leadership skills enable you to guide teams effectively, delegate tasks, and ensure project milestones are met on time. You excel in communicating complex technical concepts clearly and enjoy fostering collaborative relationships with diverse stakeholders. A valid EU driver’s license (B-level) and fluency in English complete your profile.


Join us at Volvo Cars, where your work will shape the next generation of premium vehicles and drive the future of safe and intelligent mobility.
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Software Engineering Analyst
description:
**Who We Are**
--------------



At Volvo Cars, we are committed to creating advanced vehicle technologies that enhance safety, performance, and the driving experience. Our team works on cutting-edge automotive camera systems designed to improve vehicle awareness and driver assistance features. We are passionate about innovation, quality, and continuous improvement, enabling our vehicles to lead the automotive industry toward a safer and more connected future.


**What You'll Do**
------------------



As an Exterior Camera Verification Engineer, you will play a key role in ensuring that our vehicle camera systems meet the highest standards of quality, reliability, and safety. You will design and implement automated test scripts and frameworks, working with both hardware and software teams to validate functionality and system integration. This includes building camera system test rigs, conducting manual and automated testing in test environments and vehicles, and troubleshooting any issues that arise.


Your responsibilities will also involve defining comprehensive test plans and strategies in collaboration with cross-functional teams, ensuring that testing requirements are fully aligned with product goals. You will maintain detailed test documentation, report on testing progress, and contribute to continuous improvements in system performance, reliability, and compliance with safety standards.


**Who You Are**
---------------



You have a strong educational background, holding a bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, or a related field. You are proficient in programming languages such as Python and C++ and have experience with test automation frameworks and image processing tools.


You have a proven track record of developing and maintaining automated test solutions, ideally in the automotive or related industries. Your problem-solving skills enable you to diagnose and resolve complex issues efficiently, while your attention to detail ensures that your work meets the highest quality standards.


Collaboration comes naturally to you, and you excel at communicating effectively with engineers, stakeholders, and team members. You are proactive, driven, and ready to take ownership of your projects from start to finish. Holding a European B driving license is a valuable asset for this role.


Join us in pushing the boundaries of automotive camera technologies and shaping the future of vehicle safety and innovation.

title: Diagnostics Engineer to DevPort
description:
**DevPort is now looking for a Diagnostics Engineer to join us for assignments with our clients!**



DevPort is looking for our next Diagnostics Engineer! In this role, you will be hired as a consultant in our competence area, Digital Solutions, and work on an assignment with our client. As a Diagnostics Engineer, you will play a key role in supporting the diagnostic systems, interpreting standards, and writing specifications. You will be part of a team working with platform diagnostics at our client. As part of this role, you will also support fault tracing strategies. You and your team will own and work with specifications and standards related to diagnostics, such as software download for UDS-based systems.


### **This is Digital Solutions at DevPort:**



Our expertise in embedded systems spans a wide range of areas, including software development, electronics design, and testing and verification. Additionally, we provide specialized consultancy services in niche technical and subject areas. With a strong foundation in the automotive industry, we are well-equipped to support our industrial clients in developing and ensuring the quality of advanced systems.



In IT, we take a hands-on approach to operational development, delivering expertise to design and build high-quality software solutions. With experience spanning traditional industries and start-ups, we craft tailored solutions aligned with the latest technologies and trends, creating value for both our clients and their end-users.


### **We are looking for/Requirements:**


* A degree in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering
* 3 or more years of experience working as a Diagnostics Engineer, System Engineer, or similar
* Experience working with diagnostics and fault tracing
* Experience with UDS - Unified Diagnostic Services
* Experience in SystemWeaver
* Knowledge of programming
* Fluency in both spoken and written English

### **What We Offer:**


* **Diverse and Challenging Assignments**: Engage in exciting projects with various clients and industries where your skills will be highly valued.
* **Flexible Compensation**: Choose between two different salary models - it's your choice!
* **Inspiring Work Environment**: Participate in fun activities and conference trips that strengthen the team and create memorable experiences.
* **Continuous Development**: Enhance your skills through our special projects and lunch lectures covering topics from social skills and stress management to advanced battery technology.
* **Innovative Tasks**: Work with cutting-edge products and the latest technologies in an environment that fosters creativity and innovation.

### **Application**



If this sounds like something you want to be a part of, apply by following the steps below.



If you have any questions, send an email to Samuel Bogeryd at [email protected]



We are looking forward to reading your application!


### **About DevPort**



DevPort is a technology consulting company in an expansive development phase with headquarters in Gothenburg and offices in Stockholm, Linköping, Jönköping, Helsingborg, and Karlskrona. DevPort has its core competence in the automotive industry and employs more than 500 people in three competence areas - Digital Solutions, Production Development, and Product Development.



We are proud of our employees and of collaborating with several of the world's leading vehicle manufacturers, companies in the defense industry, and other development-intensive industries.



We are characterized by a family culture with entrepreneurship, competence, security, and a community that infuses the company's operations and contributes to a pleasant and inspiring workplace

title: Junior Project Engineer (Stockholm)
description:
Department: Operations

Number of interviews: 2-3

Dependents: 0

No. hours per week: 40

Schedule: Monday to Thursday: 8am to 5pm; Fridays 8am to 2pm.

Benefits: Telephone

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

We are looking for a **Project Engineer for SICE Nordic division**. The essential duties and responsibilities for this job are connected to participate in the team that is working in the construction of the Blue Line of the Metro of Stockholm.

**The essential duties and responsibilities for this job are connected to the implementation of ITS & electromechanical systems within infrastructure projects:**

* Assistance to project manager.
* Create, read, understand, and review project documents ranging from top level design documents to detailed system design.
* Basic and detailed engineering: provide technical support in construction planning and design; resolution and documentation of design conflicts; etc
* Develop project-related documentation as well as test protocols and procedures (under project manager’s supervision)
* Administration and daily work on client’s platforms for documentation, notifications, etc.
* Represent company, project and/or department during project management meetings.
* Develop, implement, and administer project engineering procedures and other work controlling documents.
* Interfacing with the project team at SICE (Madrid).
* This position might require occasional jobsite visits to active construction zones.
* Occasional nightwork might occure.

**The requirements for this job position are:**

* Proficiency in English with excellent verbal & written communication skills.
* Engineering university degree (or students at their 3rd year of bachelor).
* Proactivity and willingness to take further responsibilities.
* Team player: open minded, collaborative, ready to help/support when needed.
* Extensive use of MS Office package.
* Use of CAD softwares.
* Good time management.
* Must demonstrate eligibility to work in Sweden.
* Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.

**Additional valuable skills.**

* Basic knowledge in 3D modelling, BIM modelling, drawings handling, etc.
* Work experience in similar assignments
* Knowledge in Traffic Systems such as Tolling Systems, Intelligent Transport Systems, Tunnels, etc.
* Previous working experience in Sweden’s national authorities such as Trafikverket, FUT
* Previous working experience with the following software:

o Projectwise

o Autocad, Revit and similar

***Please send your CV in English.***

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: 32 000,00kr - 34 000,00kr per month

Application Question(s):

* Are you legally authorized to work in Sweden?
* Do you have any work experience related to the position?
* CAD-experience is important. Do you have experience modeling in CAD?

Language:

* Swedish (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Social Media Specialist (Part-Time, 50%)
description:
Are you passionate about crafting engaging campaigns, analyzing data, and driving creative strategies? Join Jobylon as our Social Media Specialist and become a vital part of our mission to revolutionize hiring!
  
  

What You’ll Be Doing
  
  

As our Social Media Specialist, you will play a key role in helping our customers grow their employer brands through creative and data-driven campaigns. You’ll:
  
  

Create, manage, and optimize campaigns across Meta, Snapchat, TikTok and LinkedIn Ads Manager.
  
Write engaging copy for ads and campaigns to attract top talent for our clients.
  
Design visuals with basic graphic design tools.
  
Analyze performance data, conduct A/B tests, and optimize campaigns for better results.
  
Collaborate with our team to brainstorm and implement creative solutions for client growth.
  
  

This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a dynamic, creative environment and enjoys the balance of analytical thinking and artistic expression.
  
  

Wagner Barretto
  
Lead Engineer
  
"As an engineer, you get the chance to work close to the business and participate in project decisions. This makes our work feel more impactful on the business and our customers."
  
Martin Linder
  
VP Sales & Marketing
  
"We are on an incredible journey and we have just started scratching the tip of the iceberg in terms of growth. If you want to be a part of building a function, this is really the place for you."
  
Elina Bergström
  
VP Customer Success
  
"Everyone working at Jobylon is amazing and super different, but we complement each other in a really good way. Our Happiness culture, as we call it, might sound cheesy, but we do it genuinely."
  
Emelie Strandberg
  
Team Lead Customer Success
  
"What I love most is that I get to grow together with an inspiring team which I'm gladly also calling my friends!"
  
  

While we value personality and potential above all, we’re looking for someone with:
  
  

Fluency in English and Swedish, both written and spoken.
  
Education in digital marketing or a related field, with a passion for learning.
  
Hands-on experience with Meta and LinkedIn Ads Manager.
  
Strong skills in writing compelling and engaging copy.
  
Graphic design abilities.
  
Skillful and passionate about analyzing, testing, and optimizing campaigns to drive results.
  
  

Ambition to help us and our clients grow exponentially.
  
A preference for working on-site in our Stockholm office.
  
  

Why Join Us?
  
  

Be part of a company with a clear mission to simplify and enhance the hiring process.
  
Work in a collaborative, innovative, and supportive environment.
  
Grow your skills and career with a team that values creativity, curiosity, and impact.
  
  

A People First culture!
  
  

Be part of building and scaling a company
  
  

J-cation - yearly trip with the whole team
  
  

Amazing benefits and perks
  
  

International career possibilities
  
  

Work with inspiring and recognisable brands
  
  

At Jobylon, we believe that technology should simplify people’s lives. We’re on a mission to make hiring a beautiful, engaging, and enjoyable process for everyone involved. Since our founding in 2011, we’ve worked tirelessly to innovate in the HR tech space and have been recognized as one of Sweden’s hottest entrepreneurs.
  
  

Jobylon offers a modern hiring software (SaaS) to companies who want to create and share beautiful job ads and manage their applicants with ease. We work with nearly 1,000 employers from over 80 countries, including amazing organizations such as Varner, Capgemini, Skanska, McDonald’s, and more!
  
  

Our culture is built on a People First mindset, where we empower every team member to make an impact. We’re a remote-first workplace but love collaborating in person when we can.
  
  

Passion for People
  
Cultivating a humanized workplace on trust, empathy, and transparency is key for us and something that is permeating our entire culture. We believe that the key to a real success lies in people feeling safe enough to be their full selves at work.
  
  

Passion for Product
  
Creating a seamless experience for our users starts with unlocking the creativity within! We lead with a curious mind and dare to ask questions, make our voices heard, challenge each other and our product in order to bring the latest technology to the market.
  
  

Passion for Business
  
Enthusiasm and grit are the driving force behind everything we do! This translates into daring to set and meet ambitious goals, walk the extra mile, and always strive for better. We bring out the best in each other by continually challenging one another and do not settle for average.
  
  

Albin Mannberg | Contact Person

title: Service Engineer- Brake
description:
**Discover your potential. Pursue your passion.**
Link Engineering Company (LINK) is a premier designer and manufacturer of precision test equipment, we specialize in developing customized solutions for Automotive, Aviation, Off-Highway, Rail and Civil Engineering industries. We are headquartered in Plymouth, Michigan, and maintain testing laboratories, manufacturing, and support facilities around the globe.
Established in 1935, we have been a family-owned company for generations, we treat our customers and employees as if they are part of our family. We set our employees up for success, as they are given constant opportunities to learn and develop new skills. As many of our team members have been with LINK for a generation or more, the LINK team is equipped with a wealth of knowledge, providing decades of hands-on experience and out-of-the-box thinking to OEMs and suppliers everywhere.  

  

We are looking for a Service Engineer/Technicianresponsible for the activities related to Field Service ( Repair,Software Support, Calibration and Preventive Maintenance), Parts ( Sales and Repair) and Equipment Commissioning for our customers based in Europe.  

**ACTIVITY**
* Independent commissioning, maintenance and calibration of brake testers and other test bench systems
* Fault analyses and repairs of all LINK systems and devices
* Support in the further development of our products through experience reports to product and service management


**PROFIL**
* Technician/master craftsman, engineering degree specializing in electrical engineering/mechatronics/mechanical engineering
* Power electronics technician with relevant professional experience in the service environment is also welcome
* Several years of experience in a comparable position, ideally knowledge in the field of brakes
* Knowledge of MS Office
* Fluent in English
* Customer and service-orientated appearance and corresponding work attitude
* High level of stress resistance
* Strong willingness to cooperate and ability to work in a team
* Willingness to travel, mainly Europe


**WE OFFER**
* Career prospects in an international and dynamic company with a well-known tradition of quality and competence
* Varied and technically complex work content with high added value.
* International customers operating in Europe
* Professional and economic growth combined with acquired skills
* Technical training
* Good working atmosphere
* Attractive salary with flexible working hours and high job security
* Permanent employment contract
